<b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Here in Ireland, with offices in Dublin, Cork and Belfast, our growing Water team has an extensive portfolio working on high profile, challenging projects, providing multidisciplinary solutions to water and wastewater, clients both here and in the UK. From feasibility studies and planning, to design, construction management and operations and maintenance, we bring together the talent and expertise necessary to deliver success.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We currently have opportunities for Project Managers ideally with relevant sector experience to join our Water team, based in our Dublin, Cork or Belfast Offices. Successful individuals will become part of a respected and ambitious company with excellent career prospects and international opportunities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Project Managers within our team undertake a key role in understanding and delivering on our client requirements. You will be required to work with and lead multi-disciplinary teams to deliver projects within agreed timeframes and budgets and to exceed our clients’ expectations. As an individual we would look to you to show experience in leadership, delivery performance, excellent communication skills combined with being a team player. The knowledge, skills and experience we value are varied as we continue to develop diverse teams.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> As a technical leader you deliver complicated work, train and develop more junior staff and take responsibility for review and assurance of others’ deliverables. You are commercially astute with an strong understanding of services in the Utilities business and are able to drive growth through commercially viable innovation, targeted sales and excellent delivery.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With a sound understanding of project management principles and application, you will have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>A good understanding of current health, safety and welfare legislation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High quality degree relevant to the environment, water, or construction sectors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working towards or Chartered or Incorporated through a relevant Professional Institution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Good understanding of the technical work undertaken in the environmental\u002Fwater sector<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to operate autonomously, with authority, skilled in developing and building relationships<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer an enthusiastic package to retain and attract the best talent.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In addition to the benefits you’d expect, UK employees also receive free single medical cover and digital GP service, family-friendly benefits such as enhanced parental leave pay and free membership of employee assistance and parental programmes, plus reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs is committed to playing a key team members role in Global Energy Transition. Our UK and Continental Europe team is growing and we’re looking for Substation Engineers at all levels to help position Jacobs for success.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us now to strengthen our substation design team and grow our capability for the transmission and distribution systems of the future. You’ll have the opportunity to provide support to the full value chain offering for transmission operators, distribution network operators, wind, solar, energy storage and ancillary services developers. As well as our cross-sell markets of Transportation, Cities Places, Advanced Facilities, Nuclear and Defence.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As part of our diverse team, you’ll be involved in a range of services from feasibility design through to the preparation of technical specifications, production of detailed construction drawings and design compliance checks throughout the design process on all elements of EHV and HV primary plant, including substations, energy storage systems and inertia plant.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will also create trusted relationships with clients, contribute to bid preparation and provide mentoring\u002Fguidance for colleagues.<\u002Fp> \n <p>#energypowerjobs<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s Degree \u002F Masters in Electrical Engineering or HNC\u002F HND qualifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven technical ability in the design and application of EHV power system plant up to and including 400kV, including LV electrical systems and earthing design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expert in technical Substation plant design and deep understanding of the associated disciplines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Passion for delivering innovative solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Flair for client communications, having built a reputation as a trusted advisor.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evidence of leading bid preparation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A passion for developing the talent of the future.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Under general supervision develop basic engineering designs and specifications on assigned contract; provide process data to environmental groups, reviews and approves equipment RFQ’s, bid tabulations and vendor data; assists in process field work. Acts as area engineer and\u002For may be assigned equipment or technical study responsibilities under general supervision.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Process Design Basis<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Applies process design criteria, guidelines and contract requirements to process design work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>May be responsible for interacting with licensors, including establishing design basis and licensor evaluation.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Applies process design criteria and guidelines to all phases of process engineering.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Flow Diagrams<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Prepares flow diagrams and participates in flow diagram reviews.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understands the importance of the flow diagram as a communication tool to other disciplines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Is able to prepare and review flow diagrams with total information to correspond to the flow sequence, operability and the safety of the unit\u002Fsystem.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Answers questions, with confidence, from other disciplines and clients as to the requirement\u002Ffunction of each item on the flow sheet.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Back checks, updates, and ensures consistency with related design documents such as specification sheets and with other units.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares and reviews metallurgy flow diagrams.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Equipment Datasheets<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Prepares process and utility equipment specification sheets. May be responsible for design of a system or a complete unit.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understands importance of the equipment specification sheet as a communication tool with other disciplines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares equipment duty specifications for all equipment including complex equipment such as reactors.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares detail design specification for all equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews input from other disciplines for compatibility with process design for all equipment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Control Philosophy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Prepares instrumentation process data. Assists in establishing control philosophy for relatively complex control systems to meet process objectives, including safety.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares control valves process data, relief valve data, analyzer data<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interprets control philosophy of relatively complex control systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews control systems specification sheets for consistency with process data<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews logic diagrams for relatively simple loops.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluates alternative control strategies to meet process objectives.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Calculations<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Performs specifications\u002Fcalculations and technical studies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completes conceptual developments of a major system and performs all necessary calculations for process design of systems and equipment within the assigned area.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs relatively complex technical studies under general supervision.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensures that calculations are legible, well organized, correctly references as to equipment\u002Fsystem, dated and signed.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Equipment Selection\u002FReview<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Reviews and approves equipment bid tabulations and vendor data.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expeditiously reviews equipment requests for quotes, purchase requests, bid tabulations and vendor data for conformance to specifications, process compatibility, safety and operability.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensures consistency of vendor data with other design documents such as flow diagrams, area classifications drawings, utility summaries, etc<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Plant Safety\u002FOperability<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Responsible for performing various process engineering work functions in a manner that will provide a safe and operable plant<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understands obligations and authority to make appropriate design decisions necessary for plant safety and operability.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identifies potentially lethal\u002Ftoxic substances and designs the systems handling those substances in accordance with established Jacobs\u002FClient procedures.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews the unit\u002Fplant layout for unsafe piping\u002Fequipment arrangement and for adequate access to critical valves.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists in specification of any required safety systems (eye-washers, safety-showers, gas detectors, etc).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Operating Manual<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Assists in the production of plant operating manuals. May assume overall responsibility for manuals relatively less complex units.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understands and applies guidelines developed by others regarding the required contents of the operating manuals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Writes assigned sections of the manuals for complex units or writes complete manuals for less complex units. The manuals should be technically correct, complete and clearly written.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Honours degree in Chemical Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>The successful candidate will have design experience of Biotechnology, Small Molecule API Synthesis , Fill Finish, Oral Dosage Facility Design and Operation mainly gained within an engineering design office<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Active membership in a professional body, such as the IChemE, ISPE, PDA, EI, etc. is expected as a demonstration of self-development and professional qualification<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work on own initiative and to strict deadlines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Organized and adaptable with a flexible approach to Design experience<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will provides day-to-day management of all facility services and activities within the Dublin office. You will also provide primary leadership and direct supervision of facility support staff within that location. You will be required to perform a specialized role independently and as part of a global team.and use judgment based on experience to evaluate situations and develop solutions. This position manages own workload, may delegate assignments to other team members, and provides on the job training to new team members.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Project management experience (to support office relocation project which is in the pipeline)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>NEOSH or IOSH in Health and Safety<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In addition to the benefits you’d expect, UK employees also receive free single medical cover and digital GP service, family-friendly benefits such as enhanced parental leave pay and free membership of employee assistance and parental programmes, plus reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Power and Energy team provides a range of services to our gas transmission and distribution clients including the design of their system assets and the planning of the future networks. Our projects involve both high pressure gas transmission as well as lower pressure (distribution) levels where this is associated with our prime focus.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As part of our diverse team, you’ll be contributing to a range of services from feasibility designs, route optioneering studies, conceptual designs through to detail designs and compliance checks throughout the design process on all elements of the gas transmission and distribution networks.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Typically, projects will be associated with new gas pipelines, pipeline diversions, new connections to the transmission system, new flow control, pressure reduction and storage installations and modifications to existing installations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>#energypowerjobs<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s Degree \u002F Masters in Engineering\u002F HNC\u002F HND qualifications <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrable experience within the gas transmission and\u002For distribution sector, across any pressure threshold;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Competent in the use and understanding of Industry and Client Specifications, Codes of Practice, Policies and Procedures;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Team player with good communication skills; and<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Flair for technical quality.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we don’t settle – always looking beyond to raise the bar and deliver with excellence. We apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We're looking for a Process Engineer in Ireland who is excited about working on projects that enable the heart of our clients’ business. Join us and you’ll have the chance to work on projects including state of the art industrial and commercial facilities. You’ll be accountable for schedule and technical quality of challenging engineering tasks, as you gain familiarity with the client’s expectations, scope, budget, and schedule. Your multi-discipline, highly interactive team will establish process design basis, develop process options and optimizations of selected design, and calculate and organize data for process flow sheets. You’ll be surrounded by expert mentorship opportunities to help you thrive in your new career.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Bring your curiosity, talent for multi-tasking and collaboration, and extreme organizational skills and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what drives you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together. <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Engineer in Training (EIT)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 2 years of experience working on manufacturing projects<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, you’ll also have: <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Working knowledge of ASPEN-HYSYS, PipeFlo(Professional and Compressible), AFT Fathom, HTRI, WinGems, and SmartPlant preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong communication skills both verbal and written <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Forward thinking, eager to learn best practices, and contribute with innovative ideas <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Displayed ability to learn quickly and driven to broaden knowledge base <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to collaborate and work effectively in a variety of teams, including multi-disciplinary teams <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Passion for buildings and construction <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the Opportunity <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>Here in Ireland, with offices in Dublin, Cork and Belfast, our growing Water team boasts an extensive portfolio working on high profile, challenging projects, providing multidisciplinary solutions to water and wastewater, clients both here and in the UK. From feasibility studies and planning, to design, construction management and operations and maintenance, we bring together the talent and expertise necessary to deliver success. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We currently have opportunities for Project Managers ideally with relevant sector experience to join our Water team, based in our Dublin, Cork or Belfast Offices. Successful individuals will become part of a respected and ambitious company with excellent career prospects and international opportunities. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Project Managers within our team undertake a key role in understanding and delivering on our client requirements. You will be required to work with and lead multi-disciplinary teams to deliver projects within agreed timeframes and budgets and to exceed our clients’ expectations. As an individual we would look to you to show experience in leadership, delivery performance, excellent communication skills combined with being a team player. The knowledge, skills and experience we value are varied as we continue to develop diverse teams.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> As a technical leader you deliver complicated work, train and develop more junior staff and take responsibility for review and assurance of others’ deliverables. You are commercially astute with an strong understanding of services in the Utilities business and are able to drive growth through commercially viable innovation, targeted sales and excellent delivery.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With a sound understanding of project management principles and application, you will have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>A good understanding of current health, safety and welfare legislation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High quality degree relevant to the environment, water, or construction sectors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working towards or Chartered or Incorporated through a relevant Professional Institution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Good understanding of the technical work undertaken in the environmental\u002Fwater sector<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to operate autonomously, with authority, skilled in developing and building relationships<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. We welcome feedback on our recruitment process and if you need more from us before deciding to join Jacobs then please let us know.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About The Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>We have an exciting opportunity for an Ecologist to work on projects such as the East Coast Rail Infrastructure Protection Project – the largest Coastal Protection project in Europe. We are also delivering multiple underground electricity cable projects – one of which is the largest underground cabling projects of its kind in Europe.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The team you will be joining consists of eight full-time staff in Ireland, based mainly in Dublin and Cork and supported by 100+ Ecologists in the UK, and with excellent career prospects both locally and internationally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will work as part of a diverse and highly skilled team of over 170 ecologists in the UK (600 globally) and work with hydrologists, geomorphologists, engineers, planner and project managers to provide support and advice to our clients. You will ensure ecology input is considered by project teams, work as a first point of contact and, with the support of the wider team, provide high quality technical advice.<\u002Fp> \n <p>#ecologyROI<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>The role will include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Using your experience in Environmental Impact Assessment and Appropriate Assessment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Developing and sharing skills that build team and personal resilience. This will include engagement with our global communities of practice, externally facing communications (conferences, presentations, client meetings) and training events.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Working in multidisciplinary teams – quickly building rapport and trust to ensure that ecology requirements are recognised, acknowledged and constraints acted upon.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Providing of expert advice to both clients and stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Engaging with both internal and external clients, customers, and environmental regulators to develop future workstreams, opportunities and pipelines<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>A background in ecology with relevant industry experience including technical reporting and impact assessment in cognisance of national legislation and guidance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Membership of a professional body (or experience to obtain)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to write clear and concise reports<\u002Fli> \n  <li>An experienced ecology surveyor and a good field scientist.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Current and full driving licence<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>We are happy to pay for Professional Memberships of your choice and given the global reach of Jacobs, we have internal\u002Finternational transfer opportunities. Training and support is provided and we have a focus duty of care on a personal level.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Primary Job Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Develop 3D models and pipe supports for process and mechanical systems and modifies existing designs to develop or improve them.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Generate isometrics.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Some experience in 3D piping design either on site or in a design office is required and having worked in the Pharma, Biotech or Oil &amp; Gas industry is essential.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs routine tasks under close supervision using well-defined standards and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Gathers information, makes studies, performs calculations, and prepares original rough layouts and sketches to present a design proposal.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Site visits with lead\u002Fsenior designers will be required as projects dictate and encouraged to gain experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reports administratively to the department manager and functionally as determined by the org chart on assigned projects.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>The candidate must have experience with industrial piping systems, in particular pharmaceutical and have complete understanding and application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field. Further experience in bio-technology would be an advantage but is not essential.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Having experience in leading a team of piping designers in the Pharma or a related industry is essential.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Proficient use of AutoCAD software is essential and knowledge in the use of 3D packages such as Autoplant would also be necessary.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>In addition to the benefits you’d expect, UK employees also receive free single medical cover and digital GP service, family-friendly benefits such as enhanced parental leave pay and free membership of employee assistance and parental programmes, plus reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Power and Energy team provides a range of services to our transmission and distribution clients. This includes work on transmission system assets, HVDC interconnectors, energy storage systems, inertia systems, wind farms and advanced facilities for mission critical industries in the technology and process sectors.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As part of our diverse team, you’ll be providing a range of services throughout the design process on all elements of HV cable systems (mostly from 132kV up to 500kV). This includes feasibility design through to the preparation of technical specifications, production of detailed construction drawings and design compliance checks for our major energy clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your technical expertise will ensure design compliance and governance and you’ll be considered a trusted advisor by clients, skilfully interfacing with them throughout design phases. As a team player you’ll enjoy working collaboratively with other members of the design team and encourage others to think innovatively in the way we deliver solutions to clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. Our core design team is based across Jacobs’ offices in London, Birmingham, Reading, Bristol, Cardiff, Glasgow or Exeter. However, with offices throughout the UK, we can be flexible about location and are happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>#energypowerjobs<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s Degree Electrical Engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Power systems or utility experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge of Cymcap software<\u002Fli> \n  <li>An excellent technical bias, a keen interest in technology and mathematical modelling and a methodical approach to problem solving<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication skills to articulate a clear technical direction with good social, networking and presentation skills<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <div>\n  <br> \n  <p>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Our Advanced Facilities business - reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomises the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>This position involves working as part of a multi-discipline, highly interactive and coordinated team focused on projects including semiconductor manufacturing, data centre facilities, and other state of the art manufacturing facilities. Come be a part of a vibrant, dynamic team that delivers world class designs for industry leading clients around the world. We design of some of the most complex and specialized facilities being constructed today.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Projects for our clients include feasibility studies, long-range planning studies, and full design services including programming, schematic design, design development, construction documents, and services during construction for design\u002Fbid\u002Fbuild and design\u002Fbuild projects.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated individual with strong communication skills. They will exhibit a passion and desire to apply their professional experience and knowledge in a team environment on technically challenging and professionally rewarding projects. Our team is seeking a person who understands the importance of meeting their targeted commitments while being flexible to the ever-changing and fast paced environment of our clients’ sites.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>This position involves working as part of a multi-discipline, highly interactive and coordinated team focused on projects including semiconductor manufacturing, data center facilities, and other state of the art manufacturing facilities. Come be a part of a vibrant, dynamic team that delivers world class designs for industry leading clients around the world. We design some of the most complex and specialized facilities being constructed today. This team is a fantastic place for a mid-level designer to take their career to new heights—you name the practice, we’ve got an expert to learn from!<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Projects for our clients include feasibility studies, long-range planning studies, and full design services including programming, schematic design, design development, construction documents, and services during construction for design\u002Fbid\u002Fbuild and design\u002Fbuild projects.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated individual with strong communication skills. They will exhibit a passion and desire to apply their technical experience and knowledge in a team environment on technically challenging and professionally rewarding projects. Our team is seeking a person who understands the importance of meeting their targeted commitments while being flexible to the ever-changing and fast paced environment of our clients’ sites.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>About the Opportunity:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Perform necessary engineering and design tasks to produce construction documents in conjunction with a team of engineers and designers<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Design telecommunication cabling infrastructures based upon client design criteria, national and international codes, TIA\u002FEIA industry standards and Telecom Distribution Methods Manual.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Are responsible for designing the following elements and systems:<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Backbone Distribution<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Horizontal Distribution Pathways<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Voice\u002FData Cables and Connecting Hardware<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Outside Plant<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Telecommunication Spaces.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Coordinate and collaborate real time with other disciplines such as electrical, life safety, I&amp;C and architectural to develop designs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Are leaders in their discipline and are responsible for direct communication and collaboration with all other disciplines as well as owners and trade partners and will coordinate with and direct production resources for creation of 2D and 3D deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follow quality and CAD\u002FBIM standards.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Perform quality review checks for 2D\u002F3D modelling and Mech\u002FHVAC deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Display strong communication and interpersonal skills and have the ability to work in a fast-paced team environment with multiple deadlines.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Perform site surveys and design verification.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <div> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Data Centre \u002F Semiconductor experience preferable, or large scale industrial.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong relevant engineering\u002Fdesign experience in industrial\u002Fadvanced technology sector.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Engineering\u002F design experience in the telecom systems<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in equipment layout definition.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent English level - written and spoken,<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum 4 years proven leadership in building telecom system design<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working knowledge of NEC and current BICSI standards<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to interact with other engineering disciplines, clients, and vendors at all levels.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience using REVIT and BIM.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5-10 years’ experience in design of telecom systems for semiconductor facilities<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n   <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n   <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n   <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n   <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, you will work with the most talented professionals and thought leaders to shape the future of the global professional services sector as we deliver ground-breaking and life-changing solutions for a more connected, sustainable world. With more than $12 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 50,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of services including scientific, technical, professional construction and program-management for business, industrial, commercial, government and infrastructure sectors.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In order to support our growth strategy, we are seeking applications for the position of Senior Construction Manager. As a Senior Construction Manager with Jacobs you will be responsible for helping to bid and secure Construction Management (CM) opportunities, develop appropriate execution strategies as well as direct CM teams to execute and deliver large scale Biotech\u002FPharma projects located in Ireland and mainland Europe. <\u002Fp>\n <p>This position will report to the European Construction Director for Advanced Facilities. Candidate is required to have a valid work permit to work in Ireland and mainland Europe.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>The Senior Construction Manager is assigned to a project as the most senior member of the Construction Team with responsibility for the proper and timely construction of the project in accordance with the design, the control estimate and other specific requirements of the contract, all in accordance with the Jacobs SOP’s, WI’s, standards etc. The Senior Construction Manager is responsible for the management of all construction activities including but not limited to:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Safety<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Daily meetings with client representatives<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Daily meetings with the subcontractors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Managing construction and engineering teams from Jacobs and various sub-contractors to work together to complete the project safely, within the schedule and budget and to the highest quality standards.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>The Senior Construction Manager also provides the primary link between the client and Jacobs during the construction phase of the project.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The duties of theSenior Construction Manager are set out below but also include any other reasonable activity as directed from time to time to suit the needs of a particular project:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Carries out Constructability Reviews and Interactive planning sessions with the Client and Design Team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensures that the site construction phase of a project is adequately provided with suitably capable, qualified and experienced personnel, together with all the necessary plant, tools, temporary facilities and other resources.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Discharges Jacobs’ contractual responsibilities for the site construction of a project safely, efficiently, within budget and to the quality standards required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develops a best in class site enabling plan to support a positive culture from the outset of the project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Complies with the Jacobs construction methods, procedures and practices in all respects, particularly those relating to quality assurance, safety, personnel and industrial relations; where these are found to be inadequate immediately reports the deficiencies and suggests solutions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensures that the applicable statutory and other legal requirements are properly observed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understands the implications of the Health and Safety at Work Act and Regulations as they affect the responsibilities of employees, site visitors, Jacobs etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Keeps abreast of developments in the construction industry and assists in ensuring that the Jacobs capability continues to develop and excel.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensures that the project is constructed to the drawings, specifications, applicable standards, good construction practices, to schedule and in accordance with the cost budget.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Directs and controls the activities of the assigned staff and their functions to comply with the cost budget requirement.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitors the site accounting practices and control of the site cash and ensures the Jacobs procedures are properly discharged.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Carries out assessments and appraisals of the staff and records the results in accordance with Jacobs practice.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Determines the needs for staff training for proper execution of the project under construction and makes recommendations accordingly.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Adheres to the Jacobs policies for the employment of labour and ensures that all matters concerning labour relations are dealt with in accordance with the labour agreements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Properly implements the Client's regulations for Fire, Safety and Security.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepares and submits at the prescribed dates the required reports on Quality Assurance, Quality Control, progress and costs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Co-ordinates and negotiates with Client's representatives on construction matters relative to the contract requirements.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Degree qualified in appropriate management, construction, engineering subject or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Significant experience as Construction Manager for large scale, complex projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Life Science, Semi-conductor, Data Centre or advanced manufacturing projects are an advantage<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in different regions across Europe<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. We welcome feedback on our recruitment process and if you need more from us before deciding to join Jacobs then please let us know.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>This challenging position involves working as part of a multi-discipline, highly interactive and coordinated team focused on projects including semiconductor manufacturing, data center facilities, and other state of the art manufacturing facilities. Come be a part of a vibrant, dynamic team that delivers world class designs for industry leading clients around the world. We design of some of the most complex and specialized facilities being constructed today.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Projects for our clients include feasibility studies, long-range planning studies, and full design services including programming, schematic design, design development, construction documents, and services during construction for design\u002Fbid\u002Fbuild and design\u002Fbuild projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated individual with strong communication skills. They will exhibit a passion and desire to apply their professional experience and knowledge in a team environment on technically challenging and professionally rewarding projects. Our team is seeking a person who understands the importance of meeting their targeted commitments while being flexible to the ever-changing and fast paced environment of our clients’ sites.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Electrical Engineers:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Organize, assign, and delegate necessary engineering and design tasks to produce construction documents in conjunction with a team of engineers and designers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage scope, budget and schedule to meet project goals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and collaborate real time with other disciplines such as mechanical, structural, architectural and process to develop designs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Take responsible charge of the electrical design, including technical accuracy, completeness, and quality of electrical construction documents.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyze and design complex building systems, including: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Medium and low voltage power systems<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Lighting, grounding, and process heating systems<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Standby generator and UPS systems for critical power needs<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Are responsible for up front site selection and due diligence activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Exercise judgment in developing plans or alternatives and work with teams to assure quality plans.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform field activities such as observation of construction activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review construction submittals for conformance with the intent of contract and design documents.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide guidance and mentoring to project electrical engineers and designers on a project-by-project basis.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Hons Degree Electrical Engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years’ experience in engineering design of building electrical systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in application of National Rules for Electrical Installations (ET101) and applicable local building\u002Fspecialty codes<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally you will also have;<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>5 years’ experience in engineering design of building electrical systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Extensive experience in design of semiconductor or other advanced manufacturing facilities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in Semi-conductor Tool Install and Data Centre design<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Start your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We’re proud to hold longstanding partnerships with the world’s leading Life Sciences firms. From designing a facility to manufacture transformative therapies, to accelerating the delivery of life-saving products, we help our clients solve their most important challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our aim is to give the best minds of today the platform to create the cures of tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As our clients work to meet aggressive timelines, we strive to be the catalyst for innovation. We provide end-to-end project delivery from a trusted partner in a fast, smart and safe way – on time and within budget.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With more than half a century’s relevant experience to draw upon, this adds up to a total one-stop facility service for our clients.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>At Jacobs we provide the resources to turn great ideas into reality, and we’re looking for the most talented and passionate individuals out there to be our next generation of leaders.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Working in a project based environment you will need a relevant honours degree as well as drive, enthusiasm and the ability to work on your own initiative. The role will involve a mixture of office and site based responsibilities. Although post qualification experience is not vital we are looking to attract people who can show experiences of teamwork and initiative. As a project based organisation, the ability to be flexible about location will be of benefit.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What you’ll be doing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re transforming intangible ideas into innovative solutions designing the future - today.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will be assigned specific responsibilities when you start and a mentor will be identified to help you with your development.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>You will hold or will be studying for a BEng (Honours) in Electrical \u002F Electronic Engineering with a power option.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Start your journey with Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) is recognised throughout industry as a benchmark of good practice and is designed to fulfil the needs of all graduates, in addition to technical development needs specific to their particular discipline.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>Graduates complete a series of competencies based upon business requirements, comprising the optimum mix of blended learning which compliments chartership progression and provides them with the technical and business acumen required to advance their career. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In addition to the benefits you’d expect, UK employees also receive free single medical cover and digital GP service, family-friendly benefits such as enhanced parental leave pay and free membership of employee assistance and parental programmes, plus reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>About the opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs have an enviable reputation in Highways, Rail, Local Government and Aviation, supporting our clients across Europe we are committed to being a Digitally Enabled Business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As an engaging, customer centric, solution focussed professional, you will deliver excellence for our high-profile Transportation Clients. You will lead Information Management (IM) within our Transportation business as a senior representative for the implementation of the UK BIM Framework including ISO19650 Series within your allocated portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>Accountabilities of the Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Managing Talent:<\u002Fb> As one of our Lead Information Managers, you will be responsible for managing one or more of our portfolios within our Transportation business. This will include managing your team and resources appropriately to ensure that the team has awareness of work and their priorities. You will work closely with the IM Market Lead(s) to identify the new opportunities from your Portfolio.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Delivery Excellence:<\u002Fb> As Lead Information Manager you will oversee your portfolio to ensure the implementation of effective IM, which will include direct involvement in schemes. You will be responsible for the delivery excellence of your portfolio(s) with joint accountability alongside Technical Solution Managers and Project Managers in accordance with the Transportation Information Delivery Plan and client requirements. Working with Delivery 4.0 and Project Technical Services you will standardise software use, driving consistency across the capabilities and your portfolio(s).<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Leadership:<\u002Fb> You will be the key connection point from the Portfolio Lead(s) into IM, for new opportunities, innovation and risk mitigation relating to Information Delivery, including BIM. You will create a common understanding of the requirements, working towards the bigger picture and communicating this effectively to the Information Managers within the Portfolio(s). Foster an inclusive environment and collaborative community, celebrating success of individuals through our HR processes such as the E3 System.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Transformation:<\u002Fb> You will seek to implement innovative methods of delivery processes including automation and standardisation whilst working with your team to actively raise the standard of IM across our projects in your portfolio(s), with an ability to coach within and outside of your team.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Commercial Performance:<\u002Fb> Within your portfolio(s), you will be responsible for the commercial performance of delivery and undertake forecasting, risk management and report on performance measures for IM.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Maintain Delivery Momentum:<\u002Fb> You will drive teams and set the pace, ensuring teams are working towards commitments solving issues related to delivery within your portfolio(s).<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>About you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  As a Lead Information Manager for at least one portfolio within our Transportation business, you will undertake a key role in helping our clients achieve their outcomes. As an individual we would look for you to show experience in leadership, delivery performance, excellent communication skills combined with being a team player. The knowledge, skills and experience we value are varied as we continue to develop diverse teams. Additionally, you will also be able to;\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Be the initial escalation point for the portfolio(s) and must have an awareness of the bigger picture<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Foster a
