<b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. Working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In addition to the benefits you’d expect, UK employees also receive free single medical cover and digital GP service, family-friendly benefits such as enhanced parental leave pay and free membership of employee assistance and parental programmes, plus reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>About the opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs have an enviable reputation in Highways, Rail, Local Government and Aviation, supporting our clients across Europe we are committed to being a Digitally Enabled Business. As an Information Manager within our Transportation business you will be responsible for the implementation of the UK BIM Framework including ISO19650 Series within your allocated projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As an engaging, customer centric, solution focussed professional, you will deliver excellence for our high-profile Transportation Clients.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Accountabilities of the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Information Management Function:<\u002Fb> As a key member of the Project Delivery team, you will be the responsible person for all matters relating to Information Management Delivery. The Information Manager is aligned with the Project Manager and Solution Manager to ensure adherence of the Project Delivery Strategy. You will be responsible for managing the People, Process, Solutions &amp; Procurement functions to drive action in digital delivery delivery. You will focus on managing Project Information, use of the Common Data Environment, verification of the Project Information Model content. information governance and “BIM” standard adherence.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Delivery Excellence:<\u002Fb> In project delivery you will be responsible for the daily management, integrity and security of information created and delivered, whilst supporting project teams in delivery excellence, assisting with learning programmes and working collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to improve the quality of our outputs. Your collective aim is to achieve project delivery excellence to agreed budgets and programmes through eliminating waste for our clients, projects and business whilst ensuring contractual and commercial compliance is maintained.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Leadership: <\u002Fb>You will be solutions focused, proactive and able to delegate tasks effectively to your team. You will be accountable for effective Information Management upon a project and possess the ability to coach and guide your team, to achieve technically excellent delivery.<br> Governance: Through your understanding of the client and industry requirements you will ensure all commercial agreements are in place and documented accordingly. You will develop, oversee, and ensure the success of the Exchange Information Requirements at each delivery stage.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Commercial performance: <\u002Fb>You will hold responsibility for providing project fee estimates, monitoring spends, recording efficiencies and reporting issues to the Lead Information Manager.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>About you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  As an Information Manager within our Transportation business you will undertake a key role in helping our Clients achieve their outcomes. As an individual we would look for you to show experience in project delivery, have excellent communication skills and work well as part of a team. The knowledge, skills and experience we value are varied as we continue to develop diverse teams. Additionally, you will also be able to;\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Foster a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement, demonstrating adaptability and commitment to supporting others across the team in delivery.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Communicate effectively, allowing you to maintain relationships at all levels, internally and externally.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Harness the ability to apply the latest Information Management techniques and practices within the UK Construction and Infrastructure Industry including industry standards and government policies, together with the UK BIM Framework and the BS EN ISO 19650 series.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Establish, manage, and control the Common Data Environment with good knowledge of interconnecting Electronic Data Management Systems.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrate an understanding of authoring tools utilised by the Construction industry to manage client’s, supplier’s, and project’s graphical and non-graphical data.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrate comprehensive experience of collaboration software.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Create, set up, coordinate, and deliver Information Management Protocols and Execution Plans.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrate an understanding and knowledge of the roles, relationships and responsibilities required of Information Management within Project delivery.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assesses capability and training needs, proactively implementing training and support.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Recognise emerging technologies, opportunities and solutions that support our Clients and Project Delivery<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>#UKTransportation #TransportationIM<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Proven experience in a technical and\u002For engineering space with a thorough understanding of project information management principles and application.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience working in the Construction, or Engineering industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>A degree, HND\u002F HNC or professional certification in a related subject.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Good organisation skills and an ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience of ensuring the fundamental compliance in Information Management according to the UK BIM Framework.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience of implementing various interconnecting Electronic Data Management Systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Knowledge of transportation design processes within a multi-disciplinary engineering environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>An interest in project leadership.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Jacobs is committed to offering a career within one company and recognises the exceptional talent we have in our people. As Jacobs evolves, we want to inspire and empower you to develop your career so you too can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We are happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns, and locations to suit you and our business. This role can be based at any Island of Ireland Jacobs office.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>About the Opportunity<\u002Fb><br> Within our People &amp; Places Solutions, Buildings and Infrastructure (P&amp;PS B&amp;I) Europe team, we have significant growth plans in Ireland.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We therefore have an immediate requirement in our Growth &amp; Sales team for an experienced, and relationship-based, business development professional to lead growth in Ireland as part of our Europe growth plan. This role will expose you to the heart of the Jacobs business, sitting at the forefront of delivering our Boldly Moving Forward Strategy and the P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe Roadmap.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The Ireland Client Account Lead (CAL) is a senior leadership role, working jointly within our Irish team and working across our Cities &amp; Places and Transportation sectors. The selected candidate is jointly accountable for delivering the growth plan in both the Transportation and Cities &amp; Places sectors in Ireland, working with our Sector Growth Directors in each area for the benefit of the P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Ireland is a growth market for our business and as such is incredibly important in the future pipeline of work for Europe. This role is responsible for the development and growth of long-term and enduring client relationships in Ireland; covering key existing clients and future target clients across our Cities and Places and Transportation sectors.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The role covers key Irish government agencies in the built environment and city development market, as well as developing and growing relationships with city and local authorities across the island of Ireland; ensuring growth through regular dialogue, enticing and compelling value proposition development, and ensuring that they are fully aware of all of Jacobs’ capabilities and differentiators.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Given the nature of the Irish market, we would also expect the candidate to work with our teams on several existing and globally, high-profile accounts held by our Cites and Places team, where those clients are looking to make significant investments in the Irish market. We would therefore expect the role to have a mix of both public and private sector clients, with an agility needed to operate in both market types.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The purpose of the CAL role is to build and maintain trusted long-term relationships to deliver sustainable gross margin growth to Jacobs, by operating at senior and executive levels with client organisations. The headline accountabilities of the role are to implement separate, but synergistic Growth Plans for each target Irish Client. These Growth Plans must enhance our client relationships, deliver annual GM booking targets against planned investments, and grow the GM backlog and forward strength of the GM pipeline as measured through our Client Success Platform (CSP) hosted on SalesForce.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Our team are agile, driven, highly organised, and resilient individuals with a passion to win. We operate in pressured, client-centric, and therefore fast-paced environments, but have created a close-knit community where we constantly support each other, and share knowledge, best practices and lessons learnt.<\u002Fp> \n <p>An enthusiasm for working closely with clients, developing solutions to challenges and problems and working in disciplined teams with a motivation to overcome them is essential for success. The role will require diligence, and a curious, inquisitive nature in listening to and working with our clients- primarily at senior and executive levels- to develop innovative solutions to respond to our clients’ and society’s greatest challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  The selection process is focussed upon attributes and relevant practical experience, as opposed to prescribed levels of academic or professional qualification. Key attributes for the role include, but are not limited to:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Strong work ethic and proactivity, self-motivation, initiative, and leadership<\u002Fli>\n   <li>A client and strategic growth mindset, using business development acumen and focus on the client and their customers<\u002Fli>\n   <li>An active listener, with the interpersonal skills to engage with stakeholders at all levels of the client and within our business to create and sustain senior relationships<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Tenacity, and being prepared to step outside of your comfort zone<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ability to positively deal with unexpected change<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ability to manage and discuss doubt and complexity during challenging times<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Work regime flexibility and accepting there are periods of intense working<\u002Fli>\n   <li>A strong desire for success.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Patience, positivity, and resilience<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Enjoys team camaraderie, whilst is also being able to work independently.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Here are the behaviours we expect in the role that align with Jacobs’ core values\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Doing things right to maintain integrity and authenticity<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Aiming higher with a competitive drive to win and entrepreneurial ambition<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Challenging the accepted through curiosity and constructive challenge<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Living inclusion through collaboration, partnering, being approachable and empathetic.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Here are the experiences you’ll bring to the role\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Proven experience winning work through relationship-based sales processes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Relevant sector or industry experience, especially as it related to the Irish market.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Existing knowledge of how clients in Ireland like to operate, and to deliver trusted, local relationships<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Previous experience building effective partnerships between sales and operations (work winning and project delivery).<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Developing and implementing business, operations, or account growth plans\u002F strategies, or in managing similar clients.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>A creative approach to developing solutions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Contract and commercial risk management.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>The Jacobs’ business<\u002Fb><br> Our P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe business reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomises the \"why\" of what we do to create a more connected, sustainable world. To realise the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society – from facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water, to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Transportation business within P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe currently comprises 1,750+ staff across 25+ offices, delivering more connected, sustainable solutions for our Irish, UK, European and international clients across the Aviation, Highways and Rail sub-sectors. Our Cities &amp; Places business within P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe currently comprises over 800 staff across 20+ offices, delivering more connected, sustainable solutions for our Irish, UK, European and international clients across the Local Government, Cities Solutions, Hi-Tech Industrial and Built Environment sub-sectors.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>Our culture<\u002Fb><br> Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion, and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business, and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role. We’re happy to discuss part-time and flexible working hours, patterns, and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us, and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. We welcome feedback on our recruitment process and if you need more from us before deciding to join Jacobs then please let us know.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Jacobs. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Start your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We’re proud to hold longstanding partnerships with the world’s leading Life Sciences firms. From designing a facility to manufacture transformative therapies, to accelerating the delivery of life-saving products, we help our clients solve their most important challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our aim is to give the best minds of today the platform to create the cures of tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As our clients work to meet aggressive timelines, we strive to be the catalyst for innovation. We provide end-to-end project delivery from a trusted partner in a fast, smart and safe way – on time and within budget.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With more than half a century’s relevant experience to draw upon, this adds up to a total one-stop facility service for our clients.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>At Jacobs we provide the resources to turn great ideas into reality, and we’re looking for the most talented and passionate individuals out there to be our next generation of leaders.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Working in a project based environment you will need a relevant honours degree as well as drive, enthusiasm and the ability to work on your own initiative. The role will involve a mixture of office and site based responsibilities. Although post qualification experience is not vital we are looking to attract people who can show experiences of teamwork and initiative. As a project based organisation, the ability to be flexible about location will be of benefit.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What you’ll be doing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re transforming intangible ideas into innovative solutions designing the future - today.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will be assigned specific responsibilities when you start and a mentor will be identified to help you with your development.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>You will hold or will be studying for a BEng (Honours) in Electrical \u002F Electronic Engineering with a power option.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Start your journey with Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) is recognised throughout industry as a benchmark of good practice and is designed to fulfil the needs of all graduates, in addition to technical development needs specific to their particular discipline.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>Graduates complete a series of competencies based upon business requirements, comprising the optimum mix of blended learning which compliments chartership progression and provides them with the technical and business acumen required to advance their career. Additional benefits include:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Paid holidays of up to 34 days; inclusive of national and public holidays<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A broad flexible benefits package including the option to buy additional holidays, travel insurance, contributory pension scheme and the cycle to work scheme.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Are you ready to start your career in an inclusive, flexible, and dynamic work environment?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) and have a meaningful, positive impact on our environments, communities, and societies worldwide. Our People &amp; Places Solutions business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management. While we shape some of the very largest and most challenging landmark projects in the UK, we also deliver local projects that protect communities. We lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients’ challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What will you get?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Graduate Development Programme is a structured 2-year scheme, aiming to progress Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. We provide the framework, mentoring and experience, to help you maximise your skills and ambition across a variety of locations and markets. On joining our scheme in September 2023, you’ll rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, where our motivations lie and, most importantly, where you can make innovative contributions to our projects and help us take a step towards a more connected and sustainable world. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>About the opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Project Controls \u002F Change Control Graduate in our Dublin Office, you will learn and develop your skills to enable you to understand projects and how the key disciplines of scheduling, cost, risk and scope mesh together to form a project baseline. You will also learn that throughout the project lifecycle changes to the project baseline are managed in a rigid and auditable way to allow the project outcome to be fully understood at all stages.<\u002Fp> \n <p>To enable you to achieve this you will work towards achieving the following.<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>General Career Development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Client &amp; Stakeholder Management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Planning &amp; Performance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Risk Management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Execution: Quality &amp; Innovation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leadership Ability<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Qualified to degree level in either a Project Management, Quantity Surveying or Engineering related course<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A flexible and innovative self-starter who’s passionate about developing skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>An ability to adapt and prioritise appropriately whilst working on a number of varied projects at once<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Enthusiasm and curiosity to apply skills to the solution of real-world problems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A well-rounded person – have you travelled around the world? <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Jacobs is committed to offering a career within one company and recognises the exceptional talent we have in our people. As Jacobs evolves, we want to inspire and empower you to develop your career so you too can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We are happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns, and locations to suit you and our business. This role can be based at any Island of Ireland Jacobs office.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>About the Opportunity<\u002Fb><br> Within our People &amp; Places Solutions, Buildings and Infrastructure (P&amp;PS B&amp;I) Europe team, we have significant growth plans in Ireland.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We therefore have an immediate requirement in our Growth &amp; Sales team for an experienced, and relationship-based, business development professional to lead growth in Ireland as part of our Europe growth plan. This role will expose you to the heart of the Jacobs business, sitting at the forefront of delivering our Boldly Moving Forward Strategy and the P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe Roadmap.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The Ireland Client Account Lead (CAL) is a senior leadership role, working jointly within our Irish team and working across our Cities &amp; Places and Transportation sectors. The selected candidate is jointly accountable for delivering the growth plan in both the Transportation and Cities &amp; Places sectors in Ireland, working with our Sector Growth Directors in each area for the benefit of the P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Ireland is a growth market for our business and as such is incredibly important in the future pipeline of work for Europe. This role is responsible for the development and growth of long-term and enduring client relationships in Ireland; covering key existing clients and future target clients across our Cities and Places and Transportation sectors.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The role covers key Irish government agencies in the built environment and city development market, as well as developing and growing relationships with city and local authorities across the island of Ireland; ensuring growth through regular dialogue, enticing and compelling value proposition development, and ensuring that they are fully aware of all of Jacobs’ capabilities and differentiators.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Given the nature of the Irish market, we would also expect the candidate to work with our teams on several existing and globally, high-profile accounts held by our Cites and Places team, where those clients are looking to make significant investments in the Irish market. We would therefore expect the role to have a mix of both public and private sector clients, with an agility needed to operate in both market types.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The purpose of the CAL role is to build and maintain trusted long-term relationships to deliver sustainable gross margin growth to Jacobs, by operating at senior and executive levels with client organisations. The headline accountabilities of the role are to implement separate, but synergistic Growth Plans for each target Irish Client. These Growth Plans must enhance our client relationships, deliver annual GM booking targets against planned investments, and grow the GM backlog and forward strength of the GM pipeline as measured through our Client Success Platform (CSP) hosted on SalesForce.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Our team are agile, driven, highly organised, and resilient individuals with a passion to win. We operate in pressured, client-centric, and therefore fast-paced environments, but have created a close-knit community where we constantly support each other, and share knowledge, best practices and lessons learnt.<\u002Fp> \n <p>An enthusiasm for working closely with clients, developing solutions to challenges and problems and working in disciplined teams with a motivation to overcome them is essential for success. The role will require diligence, and a curious, inquisitive nature in listening to and working with our clients- primarily at senior and executive levels- to develop innovative solutions to respond to our clients’ and society’s greatest challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  The selection process is focussed upon attributes and relevant practical experience, as opposed to prescribed levels of academic or professional qualification. Key attributes for the role include, but are not limited to:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Strong work ethic and proactivity, self-motivation, initiative, and leadership<\u002Fli>\n   <li>A client and strategic growth mindset, using business development acumen and focus on the client and their customers<\u002Fli>\n   <li>An active listener, with the interpersonal skills to engage with stakeholders at all levels of the client and within our business to create and sustain senior relationships<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Tenacity, and being prepared to step outside of your comfort zone<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ability to positively deal with unexpected change<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ability to manage and discuss doubt and complexity during challenging times<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Work regime flexibility and accepting there are periods of intense working<\u002Fli>\n   <li>A strong desire for success.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Patience, positivity, and resilience<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Enjoys team camaraderie, whilst is also being able to work independently.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Here are the behaviours we expect in the role that align with Jacobs’ core values\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Doing things right to maintain integrity and authenticity<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Aiming higher with a competitive drive to win and entrepreneurial ambition<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Challenging the accepted through curiosity and constructive challenge<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Living inclusion through collaboration, partnering, being approachable and empathetic.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  Here are the experiences you’ll bring to the role\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Proven experience winning work through relationship-based sales processes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Relevant sector or industry experience, especially as it related to the Irish market.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Existing knowledge of how clients in Ireland like to operate, and to deliver trusted, local relationships<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Previous experience building effective partnerships between sales and operations (work winning and project delivery).<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Developing and implementing business, operations, or account growth plans\u002F strategies, or in managing similar clients.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>A creative approach to developing solutions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Contract and commercial risk management.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>The Jacobs’ business<\u002Fb><br> Our P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe business reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomises the \"why\" of what we do to create a more connected, sustainable world. To realise the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society – from facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water, to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Transportation business within P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe currently comprises 1,750+ staff across 25+ offices, delivering more connected, sustainable solutions for our Irish, UK, European and international clients across the Aviation, Highways and Rail sub-sectors. Our Cities &amp; Places business within P&amp;PS B&amp;I Europe currently comprises over 800 staff across 20+ offices, delivering more connected, sustainable solutions for our Irish, UK, European and international clients across the Local Government, Cities Solutions, Hi-Tech Industrial and Built Environment sub-sectors.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>Our culture<\u002Fb><br> Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion, and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business, and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role. We’re happy to discuss part-time and flexible working hours, patterns, and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us, and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About The Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>We have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Ecologist to work on projects East Coast Rail Infrastructure Protection Projects – the largest Coastal Protection project in Europe. We are also delivering multiple underground electricity cable projects – one of which is the largest underground cabling projects of its kind in Europe.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The team you will be joining consists of eight full-time staff in Ireland, based mainly in Dublin and Cork and supported by 100+ Ecologists in the UK, and with excellent career prospects both locally and internationally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will work as part of a diverse and highly skilled team of over 170 ecologists in the UK (600 globally) and work with hydrologists, geomorphologists, engineers, planner and project managers to provide support and advice to our clients. You will ensure ecology input is considered by project teams, work as a first point of contact and, with the support of the wider team, provide high quality technical advice.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>The Role Will Include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Using your experience in Environmental Impact Assessment and Appropriate Assessment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Developing and sharing skills that build team and individual resilience. This will include engagement with our global communities of practice, externally facing communications (conferences, presentations, client meetings) and training events.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working in multidisciplinary teams – quickly building rapport and trust to ensure that ecology requirements are recognised, acknowledged and constraints acted upon.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Being the first point of contact in the provision of expert advice to both clients and stakeholders.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Engaging with both internal and external clients, customers, and environmental regulators to develop future workstreams, opportunities and pipelines.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>We are happy to pay for Professional Memberships of your choice and given the global reach of Jacobs, we have internal\u002Finternational transfer opportunities. Training and support is provided and we have a focus duty of care as individual level.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>#ecologyROI<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>A background in ecology with significant relevant industry experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Chartered membership of a professional body (or experience to obtain chartership)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced in running on medium to large scale projects.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Good level of personal responsibility.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Are you ready to start your career in an inclusive, flexible, and dynamic work environment?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) to start your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, environment and communities. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Some of our very own Jacobs Graduates have contributed to this advert – so you’re getting a firsthand account of what it’s like to work with us!<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What we do at Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our People &amp; Places Solutions (P&amp;PS) business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management. We lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients’ challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What’s in it for you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Jacobs Graduate you will join a structured 2-year programme aimed at progressing Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. Our GDP provides the framework, mentoring and expertise, supporting you to reach your full potential. On joining our programme in September 2023 in our Cork office, you will rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, what motivates us and how you can make innovative contributions to our projects, helping us build a more connected and sustainable world.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul> \n  <li><p>Qualified to degree level or a Masters in a STEM subject with Project Management attributes<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>Demonstrable knowledge or experience in the Water Services sector either through relevant degree or undergraduate experience.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>To be a flexible and innovative self-starter who brings a curious mindset to finding solutions for real-world problems<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>The adaptability to learn, unlearn and reprioritise as things around you change<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>You must have the permanent right to work in Ireland.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>We want you to bring your whole, authentic self to Jacobs - have you travelled around the world? <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About The Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Ecologist to work on projects such as the East Coast Rail Infrastructure Protection Project – the largest Coastal Protection project in Europe. We are also delivering multiple underground electricity cable projects – one of which is the largest underground cabling projects of its kind in Europe.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The team you will be joining consists of eight full-time staff in Ireland, based mainly in Dublin and Cork and supported by 100+ Ecologists in the UK, and with excellent career prospects both locally and internationally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will work as part of a diverse and highly skilled team of over 170 ecologists in the UK (600 globally) and work with hydrologists, geomorphologists, engineers, planner and project managers to provide support and advice to our clients. You will ensure ecology input is considered by project teams, work as a first point of contact and, with the support of the wider team, provide high quality technical advice.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are happy to pay for Professional Memberships of your choice and given the global reach of Jacobs, we have internal\u002Finternational transfer opportunities. Training and support is provided and we have a focus duty of care on a personal level.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>The Role Will Include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Using your experience in Environmental Impact Assessment and Appropriate Assessment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Developing and sharing skills that build team and personal resilience. This will include engagement with our global communities of practice, externally facing communications (conferences, presentations, client meetings) and training events.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working in multidisciplinary teams – quickly building rapport and trust to ensure that ecology requirements are recognised, acknowledged and constraints acted upon.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Providing of expert advice to both clients and stakeholders.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Engaging with both internal and external clients, customers, and environmental regulators to develop future workstreams, opportunities and pipelines.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>#ecologyROI<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>A background in ecology with relevant industry experience including technical reporting and impact assessment in cognisance of national legislation and guidance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Membership of a professional body (or experience to obtain)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>An experienced ecology surveyor and a good field scientist.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to write clear and concise reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in running medium-scale projects<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent.<br> In addition to the benefits you’d expect, UK employees also receive free single medical cover and digital GP service, family-friendly benefits such as enhanced parental leave pay and free membership of employee assistance and parental programmes, plus reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business - reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs Transport Planning and Mobility Solutions discipline has developed an enviable reputation in Ireland. Our projects involve working with various major clients in the transport industry, including local authorities, private sector, and government, throughout Ireland and the UK, and Europe.<br> <br> We work extensively with high-profile clients including the National Transport Authority (NTA), Transport Infrastructure Ireland (TII) and Local Authorities throughout Ireland. Some of our recent nationally and regionally significant project wins include:Strategic Planning Framework for the NTA, Transport Modelling Framework Services for the NTA &amp; Cork Light Rail Route Alignment Study.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for Senior Transport Planners to join our growing team located in Dublin, Cork and Belfast. We are particularly interested in candidates who can demonstrate technical experience, or design experience in assessing the feasibility of various forms of transport infrastructure assets e.g., like walking, cycling, buses, rail and light rail through different appraisal stages for successfully attracting funding through a range of local and national sources.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In addition, we are looking, for people with knowledge of, and\u002For in the application of the Common Appraisal Framework (CAF), Project Appraisal Guidelines (PAG), The Public Spending Code, and other complementary appraisal guidance to inform feasibility and funding submissions for soft and hard infrastructure projects of varied scales.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will become an integral part of a respected and ambitious team, and the role will provide every opportunity for you to make your mark and influence the continuing sustainable growth of Jacobs in Ireland and the UK. You will have the support of a line manager and our experts to guide your progress and will have on opportunity to share your skills and knowledge by training and supporting our junior staff. You will also be given the ability to pursue relevant business and technical training to support your career development as well as the freedom to grow your network and develop innovative solutions to chase new opportunities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Occasional travel within Ireland, to the UK and\u002For overseas may be required.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Degree qualifications – Level 8 or equivalent in a relevant transportation planning\u002F engineering \u002F economics \u002F maths and\u002For other discipline;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work both as part of a multi-disciplinary team as well as possessing the ability to work independently to solve problems;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working on the feasibility and option selection stages of transport projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A creative, solution-oriented individual, with a strong technical background<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with GIS systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Some experience working on transport models or utilising the outputs of modelled scenarios for road traffic and\u002For public transport studies with the ability to contribute to the success of a range of high-profile transport projects;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Highly numerate, with proven analytical skills for transport appraisal market;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in MS Excel and other data analysis tools for the transport appraisal;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Robust written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex issues concisely;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Desire to collaborate and innovate with many different teams;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to manage diverse workloads, assist with new business opportunities and embrace emerging technologies, product solutions and the future evolution of the industry.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, you will work with the most talented professionals and thought leaders to shape the future of the global professional services sector as we deliver ground-breaking and life-changing solutions for a more connected, sustainable world. With more than $12 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 50,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of services including scientific, technical, professional construction and program-management for business, industrial, commercial, government and infrastructure sectors.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In order to support our growth strategy we are seeking applications for the position of Project Director. As a Project Director with Jacobs you will direct project teams to execute and deliver large scale EPCMV Biotech\u002FPharma projects located either in Ireland or mainland Europe.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The ideal candidate must be able to take responsibility for the safe delivery of the project including contract administration, invoicing, forecasting, schedule management and quality documentation as well as managing client relationships. Your passion for safety &amp; quality should align well with our culture and you’ll be expected to demonstrate this when engaging with colleagues as well as clients. <\u002Fp>\n <p>A broad description of duties &amp; requirements are included, but not limited to, the below:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Degree qualified in appropriate management, engineering subject or equivalent <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proven ability to deliver complex projects on schedule and on budget <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proficient knowledge of project management and construction management processes and procedures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient execution planning skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Highly skilled at managing client expectations <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proven leadership skills <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong knowledge of HSE procedures and practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient knowledge of project control systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of proposals and bid processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work under a variety of contracts <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to manage a variety of subcontractors<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Degree qualified in appropriate management, engineering subject or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, you will work with the most talented professionals and thought leaders to shape the future of the global professional services sector as we deliver ground-breaking and life-changing solutions for a more connected, sustainable world. With more than $12 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 50,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of services including scientific, technical, professional construction and program-management for business, industrial, commercial, government and infrastructure sectors.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In order to support our growth strategy, we are seeking applications for the position of <b>Construction Director<\u002Fb>. As a Construction Director with Jacobs you will be responsible for helping to bid and secure Construction Management (CM) opportunities, develop appropriate execution strategies as well as direct CM teams to execute and deliver large scale Biotech\u002FPharma projects located in Ireland and mainland Europe. This position will report to the European Construction Director for Advanced Facilities. Candidate is required to have a valid work permit to work in Ireland and mainland Europe. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The ideal candidate must be able to take responsibility for the safe delivery of construction projects including contract administration, invoicing, forecasting, schedule management and quality documentation as well as managing client relationships. Your passion for safety &amp; quality should align well with our culture and you’ll be expected to demonstrate this when engaging with colleagues as well as clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>A broad description of duties &amp; requirements are included, but not limited to, the below:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Degree qualified in appropriate management, construction, engineering subject or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A passion for delivering projects to the highest Health, Safety &amp; Environmental (HSE) standards in the industry and expert knowledge of HSE procedures and practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A proven ability to deliver large scale, complex and fast-track projects on schedule and on budget<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A drive for achieving the highest quality and continuous improvement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient knowledge of project management and construction management processes and procedures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient knowledge of the different project execution methods (EPCMV, IPD, D&amp;B, DBB)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient strategy execution planning skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Highly skilled at managing client expectations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven leadership skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to manage people as well as grow and lead high-performing diverse &amp; inclusive teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient knowledge of project control systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience of proposals and bid processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience executing projects in Ireland, UK or Mainland Europe. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience executing projects in Denmark is an advantage<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work under a variety of contracts<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to manage a variety of subcontractors<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Degree qualified in appropriate construction, engineering subject or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Degree qualified in appropriate management subject or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Membership or chartership with a relevant professional body or organisation <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>In addition to the benefits you’d expect, UK employees also receive free single medical cover and digital GP service, family-friendly benefits such as enhanced parental leave pay and free membership of employee assistance and parental programmes, plus reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As Cities &amp; Places, we can create thriving places across different scales: from regions to cities, neighbourhoods to individual buildings, and by offering an integrated design approach. We have a tremendous opportunity in front of us to build upon strength to develop an interdisciplinary planning, design and delivery practice that is uniquely Jacobs, that sets the direction for the industry, and is home to the very best and brightest design thinkers, disruptors, technical experts, visionaries and storytellers. Our business unit brings together engineers, architects, designers, specialists, surveyors, urban designers, project managers and transport planners to provide collaborative and coordinated value design solutions for our clients both nationally and internationally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We have an immediate need for a Principal level Electrical Engineer specialising in building services engineering and with strong client interfacing skills. We are seeking an experienced engineer who will be responsible for providing design delivery and discipline integration of projects delivered by the Cities &amp; Places business unit. Using excellent project experience, technical awareness and communication skills, the candidate will manage projects and supervise other team members to produce designs and associated deliverables for projects that ensure Jacobs maintains the highest technical standards, levels of service and quality.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Key requirements for this role are strong communication skills with a collaborative working and positive, can-do attitude. Regular check-in meetings to review progress, design development and decisions, and to constructively resolve any blockers with project teams will be essential and form part of your day-to-day work ethic. You will need to be able to work independently and take responsibility for decision-making and output deliverables. Strong design coordination and collaboration skills with the ability to work and assume a key role within multi-disciplinary design teams is also a key aspect of this role.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This role can be based in either Dublin, Manchester or Birmingham.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>A strong technical background in building services design, construction and procurement;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Chartered Engineer and member of recognised professional institution (e.g. CIBSE)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Relevant experience in the design and specification of electrical Building Services systems to relevant standards and codes of practice<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in leading MEP teams through all stages of work winning, design and procurement;<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to nurture excellent relationships with clients, with an ability to generate business, resolve problems and exceed client expectations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Skilled in design and delivery of projects to a high quality, from concept to completion<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work as part of a team, liaising directly with clients and other design team members<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge of all other Building Services disciplines and good understanding of other buildings disciplines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to consider safety in design and develop design solutions to eliminate health and safety risks<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience of cross continental working and ability to travel<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Here in Ireland, with offices in Dublin, Cork and Belfast, our growing Water &amp; Environment team boasts an extensive portfolio working on high profile, challenging projects, providing multidisciplinary solutions to water, wastewater, environment, flood management and energy clients both here and in the UK. From feasibility studies and planning, to design, construction management and operations and maintenance, we bring together the talent and expertise necessary to deliver success.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We currently have opportunities for a Water Civil Engineer with water\u002Fwastewater engineering experience to join our Water &amp; Environment team. The successful person will become part of a respected and ambitious company with excellent career prospects and international opportunities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Successful individuals will be responsible for the delivery of engineering design elements and projects on water and wastewater projects at various stages in the project life cycle ensuring technical excellence and best practice to specification. They will be required to work with and lead multi-disciplinary teams to deliver projects within agreed timeframes and budgets and to exceed our clients’ expectations. As a senior member of our team, successful individuals will also be required to provide leadership across our team both from a technical and managerial perspective ensuring effective team development and performance.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum of an accredited Honours Civil Engineering Degree (NFQ Level 8).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working towards Chartership .<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in the water or wastewater engineering industry.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to work as part of a team, liaising directly with client and other project team members.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience of budget management, financial performance and familiar with current industry best practice.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience of leading, or be able to demonstrate potential to do so, a successful team of engineers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge of contract types and procurement options<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy.
