<b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities. People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. This role can be performed from any location in Europe as long as you have the right to work in the EU. Global travel will be required.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The world needs innovators and problem solvers who turn challenges into greater opportunities. At Jacobs, we have an insatiable curiosity about transformative trends challenging the status quo. We deliver highly valued solutions for our Life Sciences clients by applying an unrivaled depth and breadth of capabilities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We have an immediate requirement for an experienced Sales Operations \u002F Proposal Manager to join our Life Sciences Sales team. We are looking for a talented, highly motivated and enthusiastic individual. You will be part of a busy and growing global Architectural \u002F Engineering, Construction &amp; Qualification business, delivering strong visual communication while exploring external new market opportunities. Previous sales and proposal experience is essential including a proven ability to lead successful bid teams on complex, multi-million projects.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Responsible for appropriately applying our sales work process on selective pursuits to win work for the Company.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate with Sales Lead and Capture Manager \u002F Operations in developing distinctive value propositions that enhance our customers’ competitive position.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leverage global network to identify and put forward Jacobs’ unique capabilities and resources.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Organize, direct and motivate a multidiscipline pursuit team to develop strategic sales deliverables.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>The primary responsibility of the Sales Operations \u002F Proposal Manager is to drive the disciplined application of our three-phase Relationship-Based Sales (RBS) Process: <\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li>develop and advance client relationships before opportunity identification (Opening Game);<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <ul>\n   <li>strategically position us for specific opportunities (Middle Game); <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>develop high-quality opportunity-specific response documents with competitive and compelling sales messages to satisfy client business goals (End Game).<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p>Also;<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Support strategic positioning for specific opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Form and lead bid teams, look out for the team’s welfare, establish the right behaviors, and create a high-performing bid team for successful delivery.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Actively work with sales and operations to develop and implement Middle Game action plan, e.g., document due diligence in the project brief, develop Win Plan (G to VP), SWOT analysis, and Executive Summary, conduct Go\u002FNo Go and strategy review, identify execution team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Translate the winning strategy into critical themes and produce compelling sales documents utilizing benefits statements, graphics, and proofs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plan, organize, and direct all elements of qualification and tender responses, e.g., analyze client request, develop response plan (B&amp;P budget, response team, compliance check-list, response outline, schedule), initiate Go\u002FNo Go, conduct kick-off meeting, manage and work with the team to develop response sections, refine Executive Summary, conduct in-progress reviews, schedule Pricing Reviews, ensure on-time delivery of the response, Identify, manage and communicating bid risks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate with the global Life Sciences Sales Operations team.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Education: University degree<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience: 7 years of relevant experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced in working within teams in a fast-paced environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong attention to detail and an ability to establish and meet deadlines\u002Fbudgets.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong organizational, management, and research skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Good interpersonal and organizational skills to lead meetings and build relationships across operational and sales teams.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proactive, self-motivator.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong capability in Microsoft Office suite and Adobe Creative Suite. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs has secured multiple multi-year contracts and projects, supporting clients in the UK, Ireland and across the Globe. The Water team are seeking skilled people to deliver on these fantastic opportunities in the water industry and beyond. We are seeking Engineers with a Mechanical and\u002For Electrical background who are looking to grow their careers in exciting new ways.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Successful candidates will join a team of over 400 Water Professionals, working on a range of high-profile projects and become a part of a World Leading Company with excellent career prospects. You will be delivering project tasks, designs and working with clients on water and wastewater infrastructure and facilities at various stages in the project life cycle, working within our multi-disciplinary teams to deliver projects within agreed timeframes and budget.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Masters Degree or equivalent in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or similar.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstratable evidence of working toward obtaining Chartered Status (CEng) with a recognised Professional Institution.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Some experience in one or more of the following areas: Water and\u002For wastewater networks; Water and\u002For wastewater treatment works; Hydraulics; Mass water conveyance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Enthusiasm to resolve problems and enjoy working as part of a large multi-national company.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Worked within multi-disciplinary teams.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proactive with a keenness to help strengthen Client relationships and contribute to the growth of our business.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>In addition to the benefits you’d expect, UK employees also receive free single medical cover and digital GP service, family-friendly benefits such as enhanced parental leave pay and free membership of employee assistance and parental programmes, plus reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the opportunity:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Within Peoples &amp; Places Solutions, Jacobs’ Smart Places team is a dynamic, close-knit team of people who share a passion for using their expertise and the potential of digital technologies to create better places. We are a multi-disciplinary team and work on a wide variety of projects from individual smart buildings to neighbourhood-scale developments and city-wide strategies in the UK, Europe and the Middle East. We collaborate with colleagues in many disciplines, from urban design to economics and from social value to infrastructures such as energy and transport. We work in many sectors from local and national government to retail and from aviation to leisure and entertainment. Our work is rooted in our clients’ values, and in Jacobs’ values – challenging today and reinventing tomorrow to create a better world. As our business in this exciting sector grows, we are looking for a Senior Technical Consultant to help us deliver these exciting projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Key Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Specific responsibilities of the role will include:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Supporting, managing or leading smart city related technology development projects at both initial design and implementation stages, for example, developing smart city frameworks and strategies, designing and integrating different smart city solutions of various disciplines, or preparing design schemes and technical specifications for tendering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Supporting business development of smart city opportunities at both advisory and engineering levels<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working closely with various subject matter specialists and domain experts on implementation and management of different smart city strategies and applications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Managing the interface of clients from both public and private sectors, technology suppliers and other partners, for example consultants and utility bodies<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> We are looking for candidates with the following professional and personal skills:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Relevant experience in tackling multidisciplinary consultancy or service projects that cross the boundaries between the traditional engineering and other disciplines, such as IT, urban planning, and engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Preferably a member of a relevant professional institution(s) e.g. IET, BCS, IHE, IAM, or alternatively able to demonstrate comparable professional experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Good at all forms of communication, including reports, presentations, workshops and meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively translate and communicate complex technical terms with a non-technical senior client audience <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Project management, commercial awareness and stakeholder engagement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Capable of working on several projects at the same time and able to prioritise their activities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be a “details” person as well as being able work well with colleagues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willing to work internationally in Europe and Middle East<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Finally, it is critical that candidates should be passionate about creating better, smarter places, enabled by technology <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Technical\u002FQualifications<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n <p>We are particularly looking for candidates with the following domain skills:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Practical\u002Fdemonstrable experience of delivering smart \u002F digital strategies, with particular focus on the definition of technical solutions, information and operational systems and connectivity and data infrastructure for buildings, cities, regions, developments and communities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Practical experience in developing and specifying relevant smart place architecture and technologies (such as smart city and smart building platforms, 4G \u002F 5G, fibre and IoT communications, data centres, IoT technologies, AR\u002FVR, big data \u002F analytics, green and sustainability technologies etc.) <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience of developing strategies, requirements, plans, designs, service designs and architectures for operational technology deployments <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience of leading or supporting technical proposals and delivering projects for organisations in relevant sectors, including national or local government and transport bodies, property and infrastructure companies, planning and urban design or the utilities sector<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with transport, energy, construction, planners, and other built environment professions, and in particular coordinating the integration of smart elements into their infrastructure plans and strategies. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience and knowledge of innovation processes would be a bonus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Candidates will preferably hold a degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Building Services Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or related disciplines, and be a member of a relevant industry body; or should alternatively be able to demonstrate equivalent knowledge and expertise.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Pharmaceutical and biotechnology products impact all our lives in some way. The projects that we execute deliver lifesaving products to patients globally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With 50 years of experience as innovators in biopharma facilities, our more than 3,800 skilled architectural, engineering and construction professionals continue to work with our clients to drive innovations in the industry. We provide a single-source of responsibility for all services, from strategy and concept through site selection and evaluation, regulatory compliance, design, constructability, construction management, commissioning, validation and startup. We also provide operations support and asset management services, including plant engineering, maintenance optimization and traditional maintenance and turnaround services.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As the largest professional services provider to the biopharmaceutical industry, clients benefit from both our local presence and global reach. We offer a full range of design and construction services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies worldwide, with a complete focus on providing maximum value for our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Senior piping designers<\u002Fb> required for large Biotech\u002FFill Finish projects being run out of the Jacobs Cork and Dublin offices. Site visits will be required as projects dictate.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Senior piping designers required for large API\u002FBiotech\u002FFill Finish projects being run out of the Jacobs Cork and Dublin office. We will welcome applications from candidates that are interested in part-time work.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Primary Job Responsibilities <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Responsible for the complete piping design of a small area of a project or a section of a larger project. Opportunities available to work as an area lead on larger projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop 3D modelling and supporting of complex process and mechanical piping systems given basic information such as P&amp;ID's, piping specifications, equipment arrangement drawings, etc. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develop equipment layouts in green field and existing facilities. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Perform field design work\u002Fsite surveys to identify current conditions\u002Ftie-ins as required. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provide technical direction and supervision to junior\u002Fintermediate piping designers in a team environment. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare material take-offs for cost estimates and material procurement during concept and basis of design phases.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare conceptual designs, feasibility studies and equipment stack ups. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Attention to detail and commitment to quality a must in reviewing, checking and clash checking other designers work. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Review\u002Fcomment on vendor drawings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be proactive in co-ordination with other disciplines. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Attend model reviews as required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reports administratively to the department manager and day to day to the piping lead.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>3rd level engineering qualification or equivalent trade experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong work ethic with good communications skills required for working on projects with multi office execution.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>The candidate must have experience with process and mechanical piping systems in Life Sciences and have complete understanding and application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proficient in Navisworks and Plant 3D\u002FSP3D or similar 3D software essential.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop 3D modelling and supporting of complex process and mechanical piping systems given basic information such as P&amp;ID's, piping specifications, equipment arrangement drawings, etc. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare material take-offs for cost estimates and material procurement during concept and basis of design phases.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review\u002Fcomment on vendor drawings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be proactive in co-ordination with other disciplines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This graduate position involves working as part of a multi-discipline, highly interactive and coordinated team focused on projects including semiconductor manufacturing, data centre facilities and other state of the art manufacturing facilities. Come be a part of a vibrant, dynamic team that delivers world class designs for industry leading clients around the world. We design of some of the most complex and specialized facilities being constructed today.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Projects for our clients include feasibility studies, long-range planning studies, and full design services including programming, schematic design, design development, construction documents, and services during construction for design\u002Fbid\u002Fbuild and design\u002Fbuild projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The ideal graduate will be a self-motivated individual with strong communication skills. They will exhibit a passion and desire to apply their professional experience and knowledge in a team environment on technically challenging and professionally rewarding projects. Our team is seeking a person who understands the importance of meeting their targeted commitments while being flexible to the ever-changing and fast paced environment of our clients’ sites.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Hons Degree Electrical Engineering<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Start your journey with Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) is recognised throughout industry as a benchmark of good practice and is designed to fulfil the needs of all graduates, in addition to technical development needs specific to their particular discipline. Graduates complete a series of competencies based upon business requirements, comprising the optimum mix of blended learning which compliments chartership progression and provides them with the technical and business acumen required to advance their career. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Additional benefits include:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>A broad flexible benefits package including the option to buy additional holidays, travel insurance, contributory pension scheme and the cycle to work scheme.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Are you ready to start your career in an inclusive, flexible, and dynamic work environment? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What are you waiting for? Apply today! <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) to start your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, environment and communities. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Some of our very own Jacobs Graduates have contributed to this advert – so you’re getting a firsthand account of what it’s like to work with us! <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What we do at Jacobs <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>Our People &amp; Places Solutions (P&amp;PS) business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management. While we shape some of the very largest and most challenging landmark projects in Ireland and the UK, we also deliver local projects that protect communities. We lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients’ challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work. Our Transport Planning &amp; Mobility Solutions team is part of our People &amp; Places Solutions business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What’s in it for you? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>As a Jacobs Graduate you will join a structured 2-year programme aimed at progressing Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. Our GDP provides the framework, mentoring and expertise, supporting you to reach your full potential. On joining our programme in September 2023, you will rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, what motivates us and how you can make innovative contributions to our projects, helping us build a more connected and sustainable world. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>About the opportunities <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>The Transport Planning &amp; Mobility Solutions team at Jacobs is one of the largest in Ireland and the UK, with a varied client base and strong pipeline of work supporting national and international project delivery. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We are looking for talented graduates to come and join the Ireland and Scotland Team. Based in Dublin, Belfast, Edinburgh, Glasgow, we deliver for local clients as well as supporting our colleagues across Ireland, the UK and globally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our skillsets cover the full remit of transport planning and include transport modelling\u002Fappraisal, active travel, public transport network planning, streets design, traffic engineering, junction design, and transport policy and strategy. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Some of our recent nationally and regionally significant projects include:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Metrolink (Transport Infrastructure Ireland)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>BusConnects Dublin – Engineering Design and Environmental Impact Assessment Commissions (National Transport Authority)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Cork Luas Alignment Options and Feasibility Study (Transport Infrastructure Ireland)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Transport Modelling Services Framework (National Transport Authority)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Sligo Area Based Transport Strategy (Sligo County Council)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Waterford Metropolitan Area Transport Strategy (National Transport Authority)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Meath Safe Routes to School Programme (Meath County Council)<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>You will have the support of a mentor, our management team and experts to guide your progress. You will also be given the ability to pursue relevant business and technical training to support your career development. as well as the freedom to grow your network and knowledge base to create innovative solutions.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This opportunity is for transport planning and traffic engineering graduate roles in our Dublin and Belfast offices.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>An interest in transport planning\u002Ftraffic engineering such as: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Transport modelling\u002Fappraisal <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Active travel schemes<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Mass transit schemes<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Junction improvement schemes <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Place-making schemes <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Transport policy\u002Fstrategy<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Be working towards a relevant Degree or Masters level qualification such as Geography, Planning, Economics, Mathematics, Operational Research, Statistics, Data\u002FComputer Science, Civil or other Engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>To be a flexible and innovative self-starter who brings a curious mindset to finding solutions for real-world problems <\u002Fli>\n  <li>The adaptability to learn, unlearn and re-prioritise as things around you change <\u002Fli>\n  <li>You must have the permanent right to work in Ireland (for Dublin based role) or the UK (for Belfast based role).<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>We want you to bring your whole, authentic self to Jacobs - have you travelled around the world? Worked in a bar? Been captain of a sports team or volunteered for a charity? Tell us - we’re looking for people with interesting stories and experiences! <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Selection Process <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>Step 1: Apply Online <\u002Fp>\n <p>Step 2: Gamification Assessment <\u002Fp>\n <p>Step 3: Interview <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What else we provide <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>In addition to work-life balance and flexibility, employees also receive; <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Free single medical cover and digital GP service <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships <\u002Fli>\n  <li>An inclusive and diverse environment, embracing the variety of cultures, backgrounds and lifestyles of our employees through Jacobs’ Employee Networks<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A focus on safety, health, and wellbeing, prioritising our people through a culture of caring and a network of positive mental health champions <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Opportunities to give back to our communities through our Collectively program, incorporating matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>We are truly passionate about inclusion and diversity and recognise that this application and selection process may not suit all candidates. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Pharmaceutical and biotechnology products impact all our lives in some way. The projects that we execute deliver lifesaving products to patients globally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With 50 years of experience as innovators in biopharma facilities, our more than 3,800 skilled architectural, engineering and construction professionals continue to work with our clients to drive innovations in the industry. We provide a single-source of responsibility for all services, from strategy and concept through site selection and evaluation, regulatory compliance, design, constructability, construction management, commissioning, validation and start-up. We also provide operations support and asset management services, including plant engineering, maintenance optimization and traditional maintenance and turnaround services.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As the largest professional services provider to the biopharmaceutical industry, clients benefit from both our local presence and global reach. We offer a full range of design and construction services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies worldwide, with a complete focus on providing maximum value for our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Duties and responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>You will generally be responsible for supervision and technical direction over a team of engineers and designers when functioning as a lead engineer. As lead engineer, you will be responsible for total delivery of the structural deliverables and services on time, within performance budget and meeting quality expectations. Duties may include performing advanced engineering work serving as a technical specialist for a complex engineering assignment. Work at this level requires extensive progressive experience in structural engineering and involves utilization of project controls for cost, schedule and quality of projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Overall Expectations:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Maintain coordination with all team members for information, specific job scope and efficient design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Actively cooperate with members of your project task force, client personnel and members of your department, as appropriate<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Make a particular point of establishing a mutually respectful professional as well as a personal relationship with key client personnel with whom you interact<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understand client expectations, as determined by the team, and constantly strive to achieve or better these<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Meet commitments that you make to the client, individually or as a team, to complete work by certain dates or within agreed man-hour or cost budgets<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Produce flawless work without unnecessary errors<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Do not compromise safety in design or in the field.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>BSc or MSc in Civil \u002F Structural Engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Chartered engineer preferably MIStructE <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, you will also have;<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Knowledge and application of Eurocode, BSI and Irish design standards and codes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge and application of the Irish Building Regs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Theoretical and practical experience with structural computer programs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of the application of CAD,Revit and Navis software for purposes of planning work and monitoring quality of deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledgeable of the discipline specific methods, practices and techniques required to engineer, design and construct process and manufacturing projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced in estimating and scheduling professional service hours and assessing the progress and quality of civil\u002Fstructural work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Complete understanding of the skills and experience required to perform engineering and design functions in an EPC environment<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Proficient in the use of MS Word, Excel, and Mail<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Good listening, writing, communications and conflict resolution skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to lead teams to deliver on commitments<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. We welcome feedback on our recruitment process and if you need more from us before deciding to join Jacobs then please let us know.<\u002Fp> \n This team is a fantastic place for a mid-level designer to take their career to new heights—you name the practice, we’ve got an expert to learn from!<\u002Fp> \n <p>Projects for our clients include feasibility studies, long-range planning studies, and full design services including programming, schematic design, design development, construction documents, and services during construction for design\u002Fbid\u002Fbuild and design\u002Fbuild projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated individual with strong communication skills. They will exhibit a passion and desire to apply their technical experience and knowledge in a team environment on technically challenging and professionally rewarding projects. Our team is seeking a person who understands the importance of meeting their targeted commitments while being flexible to the ever-changing and fast paced environment of our clients’ sites.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Electrical Designers:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Perform necessary engineering and design tasks to produce construction documents in conjunction with a team of engineers and designers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Under the direction of a Senior Engineer, design electrical services packages in Revit &amp; AutoCAD.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and collaborate real time with other disciplines such as mechanical, structural, architectural and process to develop designs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Follow quality and CAD\u002FBIM standards.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide technical support and assistance to Electrical Engineers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyze and design complex building systems, including: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Medium and low voltage power systems<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Lighting, grounding, and process heating systems<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Standby generator and UPS systems for critical power needs<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Exercise judgment in developing plans or alternatives and work with teams to assure quality plans.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform field activities such as filed surveys and design verification.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Provide guidance and mentoring to junior designers on a project-by-project basis<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Working knowledge of AutoCAD and Revit<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5+ years of formal experience in heavy industrial engineering design<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in the complete suite of electrical engineering design services. This include (but is not limited to) MV and LV power distribution, generators, UPS systems, lighting &amp; emergency lighting, vertical transportation, small power, lightning protection, earthing &amp; bonding, and hazardous areas.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of applicable electrical engineering codes, standards and acceptable industry practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Good verbal and written communication skills required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Self-starter and can take initiative with assigned tasks and objectives<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Professional approach and demeanour<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A strong ethical approach to safety, quality and environmental protection<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Preferred requirements<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>5-10 years’ experience in engineering design of building electrical systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in design of semiconductor or other advanced manufacturing facilities<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. We welcome feedback on our recruitment process and if you need more from us before deciding to join Jacobs then please let us know.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>In addition to the benefits you’d expect, UK employees also receive free single medical cover and digital GP service, family-friendly benefits such as enhanced parental leave pay and free membership of employee assistance and parental programmes, plus reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships. We also give back to our communities through our Collectively program which incorporates matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the Opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Here in Ireland, with offices in Dublin, Cork and Belfast, our growing Water &amp; Environment team boasts an extensive portfolio working on high profile, challenging projects, providing multidisciplinary solutions to water, wastewater, environment, flood management and energy clients both here and in the UK. From feasibility studies and planning, to design, construction management and operations and maintenance, we bring together the talent and expertise necessary to deliver success.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We currently have opportunities for a Water Civil Engineer with water\u002Fwastewater engineering experience to join our Water &amp; Environment team. The successful person will become part of a respected and ambitious company with excellent career prospects and international opportunities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Successful individuals will be responsible for the delivery of engineering design elements and projects on water and wastewater projects at various stages in the project life cycle ensuring technical excellence and best practice to specification. They will be required to work with and lead multi-disciplinary teams to deliver projects within agreed timeframes and budgets and to exceed our clients’ expectations. As a senior member of our team, successful individuals will also be required to provide leadership across our team both from a technical and managerial perspective ensuring effective team development and performance.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum of an accredited Honours Civil Engineering Degree (NFQ Level 8).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working towards Chartership.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in the water or wastewater engineering industry.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to work as part of a team, liaising directly with client and other project team members.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication skills, including written work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience of budget management, financial performance and familiar with current industry best practice and a working knowledge of contract types and procurement options.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience of leading, or be able to demonstrate potential to do so, a successful team of engineers.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Are you ready to start your career in an inclusive, flexible, and dynamic work environment?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) to start your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, environment and communities. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Some of our very own Jacobs Graduates have contributed to this advert – so you’re getting a firsthand account of what it’s like to work with us!<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What we do at Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our People &amp; Places Solutions (P&amp;PS) business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management. We lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients’ challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What’s in it for you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Jacobs Graduate you will join a structured 2-year programme aimed at progressing Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. Our GDP provides the framework, mentoring and expertise, supporting you to reach your full potential. On joining our programme in September 2023, you will rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, what motivates us and how you can make innovative contributions to our projects, helping us build a more connected and sustainable world.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs is seeking Civil Engineers who are looking to begin their careers in a world-class leading company with excellent career prospects. Working as part of a multi-disciplinary team, you could be providing innovative and sustainable solutions for Clients such as Water Companies, as well as less obvious Clients like Airports.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your workload will be varied across nature (rivers), infrastructure (pipelines) and non-infrastructure (facilities). You could be: -<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>designing a Sustainable Drainage System for a new development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>assessing options for managing flood risk<\u002Fli> \n  <li>diverting operationally-critical infrastructure to allow for new development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>contributing to the determination of budgets for the next five years of investment in the Water Industry<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Our Graduates are exposed to a wide range of projects and we will support you to grow and develop into the areas that you find interesting. Whatever you decide to do, our friendly teams will be on hand to help you along the way.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul> \n  <li><p>Masters degree in Civil Engineering (Class 2.1 or better) or similar equivalent<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>Demonstrable interest in working in the Water Industry and\u002For the Environment<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>Enthusiasm to solve problems and enjoy working as part of a large multi-national company<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>A desire to apply your skills to combat the real challenges faced by the world today<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>To be a flexible and innovative self-starter who brings a curious mindset to finding solutions for real-world problems<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>The adaptability to learn, unlearn and reprioritise as things around you change<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>You must have the permanent right to work in the Ireland.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>We want you to bring your whole, authentic self to Jacobs - have you travelled around the world? Worked in a bar? Been captain of a sports team or volunteered for a charity? <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This challenging position involves working as part of a multi-discipline, highly interactive and coordinated team focused on projects including semiconductor manufacturing, data center facilities, and other state of the art manufacturing facilities. Come be a part of a vibrant, dynamic team that delivers world class designs for industry leading clients around the world. We design of some of the most complex and specialized facilities being constructed today.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Projects for our clients include feasibility studies, long-range planning studies, and full design services including programming, schematic design, design development, construction documents, and services during construction for design\u002Fbid\u002Fbuild and design\u002Fbuild projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated individual with strong communication skills. They will exhibit a passion and desire to apply their professional experience and knowledge in a team environment on technically challenging and professionally rewarding projects. Our team is seeking a person who understands the importance of meeting their targeted commitments while being flexible to the ever-changing and fast paced environment of our clients’ sites.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Our Electrical Engineers:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Organize, assign, and delegate necessary engineering and design tasks to produce construction documents in conjunction with a team of engineers and designers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage scope, budget and schedule to meet project goals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and collaborate real time with other disciplines such as mechanical, structural, architectural and process to develop designs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Take responsible charge of the electrical design, including technical accuracy, completeness, and quality of electrical construction documents.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyze and design complex building systems, including:<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Medium and low voltage power systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lighting, grounding, and process heating systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Standby generator and UPS systems for critical power needs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Are responsible for up front site selection and due diligence activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Exercise judgment in developing plans or alternatives and work with teams to assure quality plans.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform field activities such as observation of construction activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review construction submittals for conformance with the intent of contract and design documents.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide guidance and mentoring to project electrical engineers and designers on a project-by-project basis.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Key Activities<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Creation and modification of specifications, drawings, datasheets and schedules to support the electrical engineering design activities described below:<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Specification, procurement, installation, testing and commissioning of MV &amp; LV Switchgear, Conventional and Intelligent Motor Control Centres, VSDs, Transformers, UPS Systems, Generators, Power Factor Correction Equipment etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>MV and LV Power system design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Electrical design required to support industrial facilities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Executing projects in a multi-discipline 3D design environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Power systems &amp; equipment, short circuit calculations &amp; analysis and co-ordination\u002Fdiscrimination studies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Design of electrical facilities to IS, EN and IEC standards including Power, Lighting, Cabling, Cable Containment Systems, Cat 6 Structured Wiring, Fire Alarm, Earthing, Lightning Protection etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiar with the Design Workflow for Inter-discipline activities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Process \u002F Piping \u002F Mechanical Packages \u002F 3D model.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Degree or Masters in Electrical Engineering – Chartered an advantage<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in application of National Rules for Electrical Installations (ET101) and applicable local building\u002Fspecialty codes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 12 years as Electrical Engineer.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Delivery of Electrical Engineering Design to meet budget, schedule and quality requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Worked on large projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Position requires thorough knowledge of electrical design and engineering techniques.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Deep knowledge of ETCI Wiring Regulations, IEC Standards and EN Standards.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in working as part of a team in schedule driven multiple discipline projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Very good proactive communicator.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. We welcome feedback on our recruitment process and if you need more from us before deciding to join Jacobs then please let us <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Pharmaceutical and biotechnology products impact all our lives in some way. The projects that we execute deliver lifesaving products to patients globally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With 50 years of experience as innovators in biopharma facilities, our more than 3,800 skilled architectural, engineering and construction professionals continue to work with our clients to drive innovations in the industry. We provide a single-source of responsibility for all services, from strategy and concept through site selection and evaluation, regulatory compliance, design, constructability, construction management, commissioning, validation and startup. We also provide operations support and asset management services, including plant engineering, maintenance optimization and traditional maintenance and turnaround services.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As the largest professional services provider to the biopharmaceutical industry, clients benefit from both our local presence and global reach. We offer a full range of design and construction services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies worldwide, with a complete focus on providing maximum value for our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We're looking for a Civil Engineer for our Dublin office who is excited about working on projects that enable the heart of our clients’ business. Join us and you’ll have the chance to work on projects including state of the art biotech and pharmaceutical facilities. You’ll be accountable for schedule and technical quality of challenging engineering tasks, as you gain familiarity with the client’s expectations, scope, budget, and schedule. Your multi-discipline, highly interactive team will conceptualize initial civil design for land\u002Fsite development, prepare grading plans, performing earthwork and drainage\u002Fstormwater calculations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Bring your curiosity, talent for multi-tasking and collaboration, and extreme organizational skills and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfil what drives you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>General Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As Civil Engineer, you will be an integral member of the Civil engineering design and construction support team, counted on to perform Civil analysis and design for our projects and play a key leadership role in our civil team. Depending on the size and complexity of the project, you may be part of a larger design team supporting the Senior Civil Engineer or acting as the Civil Lead yourself. You will need strong communication and interpersonal skills as you work closely with the clients, project managers, other disciplines, and construction trade partners. As part of this team, you will develop design concepts, undertake analysis and design, and work with the other Designers and Engineers as part of the wider design effort.<\u002Fp> \n <p>It is expected that you have a strong working knowledge of civil principals in many subject areas, understanding of building codes with emphasis on local jurisdictional code requirements, understand how civil design integrates with and impacts other disciplines, and understand business trends and industry issues and challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Duties and Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>With limited supervision, individual competently performs all conventional aspects of civil engineering and analysis: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Plans and conducts work requiring judgment in the independent evaluation, selection, and adaptation of engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Exercises sound engineering judgement and problem-solving skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Takes responsibility for managing workload, making and keeping commitments, and taking full ownership of assigned work: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Takes complete ownership of their portion of the civil scope, reliably meeting schedule, budget, and quality requirements.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Clearly define own scope and can forecast level of effort needed to complete that scope. Be ready to identify scope change and escalate it to Civil Lead.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Ask for help when needed, and delegate to other engineers when appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to work in a timely, accurate, and cost-effective manner with strong attention to detail.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Possesses excellent organization, communication, and interpersonal skills.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 6 years of project experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Chartered Civil Engineering qualification preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong working knowledge and experience in analyzing and designing all aspects of medium to large scale industrial developments including: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Site development, site master planning and site selection.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Underground utility routing and site space planning.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Hydrology analysis for designing storm drain systems.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Analyzing and designing gravitational wastewater systems.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Performing final grading plans including cut and fill analysis and earthwork balancing.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Support permit application process.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Working knowledge and experience with AutoCAD Civil 3D, StormCAD, Storm and Sanitary Analysis, WaterCAD and WaterGEMS preferrable.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Expertise in hydrology analysis tools including Micro Drainage software.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Strong interpersonal skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, you’ll also have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous experience in biotech, pharmaceutical or general industrial facilities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Navisworks and Bluebeam.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. We welcome feedback on our recruitment process and if you need more from us before deciding to join Jacobs then please let us know.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a long and rewarding career working with the #1 ranked most admired engineering \u002F construction company in the world, and the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then Jacobs is where you belong. We are looking for a driven and progressive Cost Engineer to join our Cost Control Department to help us support our internal PM\u002FCMs and our external Advanced Facilities clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a key member of our Cost Control Team, you’ll provide the day-to-day support and execution of project controls functions for projects and programs. You will be responsible for cost control monitoring, analysis, forecasting, and reporting. You’ll manage overall projects and program cost controls and reporting function by supporting client management, updates, and presentations to all levels of management.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us and we will assist in continuing the development of your skills and exploring all that you can do across our global company, with opportunities to share your knowledge along the way.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>At least 5 years of cost engineering\u002F project controls experience <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Implementing and evaluating earned value on projects to track progress in home office and or field construction projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proactively monitoring and communicating budget, actual status, and forecast costs\u002Flabour hours for projects. Creating client and internal status reports that effectively communicate cost status.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Use analytical thinking ability to assist the project manager and or construction manager to develop accurate and timely estimate at completion on a monthly basis.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Specific experience in cost engineering functions, including cost estimating, cost control, change management, risk management, cost analysis, variance analysis<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with work breakdown structures and resolving financial issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Consults with clients, vendors, or other individuals to discuss and formulate estimates and resolve issues.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of Engineering and Construction techniques and their costs impacts<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop change notices in a timely fashion in connection with the PM\u002FCM<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates requirements for project managers and implements specific control procedures.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Ideally, here’s what you’ll also have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Preferably a Bachelor’s degree in Quantity Surveying, Business Administration, Project Management, Construction Management, or equivalent relevant work experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with a multi-disciplined group (Engineering and or Construction) to determine the EAC, the efficiency of both cost (CPI) and schedule (SPI), highlight the potential risk(s) to completion and their financial impact<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Cost Engineering \u002FProject Controls experience on EPCMV life-cycle projects in the Life Sciences, Bio-Pharma industry<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advanced Excel and\u002For Power BI skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High degree of Emotional Intelligence, team player mentality, coachable<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prolog, EPCMV project life cycle experience (home office &amp; field construction)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>EcoSys<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Why Jacobs? <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Are you ready to start your career in an inclusive, flexible, and dynamic work environment?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) and have a meaningful, positive impact on our environments, communities, and societies worldwide. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Two of our very own Jacobs Graduates have contributed to this advert – so you’re getting a firsthand account of what it’s like to work for us!<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What we do at Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>We're invested in you and your success. Our People &amp; Places Solutions business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management. We lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients’ challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What will you get?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Graduate Development Programme is a structured 2-year scheme, aiming to progress Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. We provide the framework, mentoring and experience, to help you maximise your skills and ambition across a variety of locations and markets. On joining our scheme in September 2023, you’ll rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, where our motivations lie and, most importantly, where you can make innovative contributions to our projects and help us take a step towards a more connected and sustainable world. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>About the opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As an Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) and Strategic Environmental Assessment (SEA) Graduate you will join our Dublin Environmental Assessment team while becoming part of a respected and ambitious company with a friendly culture, career prospects and international opportunities! <\u002Fp>\n <p>Our UK and Ireland EIA team is 150 strong, with diverse skills and experience delivering all stages of the consenting process from strategic assessment and EIA to post construction environmental monitoring. We specialise in nationally significant projects across Europe and you will be involved in innovative and inspiring projects that focus on renewable energy, sustainable transport, low carbon and nature-based solutions, as part of our Climate Response. The Broadlands Flood Alleviation Project is an example of one of the nationally significant climate and flood resilience projects that our EIA team is involved in. We are at the forefront of developing best practice assessments, including a range of digital EIA and SEA techniques.<\u002Fp> \n <p>For more information on our UK and Ireland EIA team, please see the EIA stall at our virtual recruitment fair.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>A degree in a relevant environmental discipline, or equivalent level of experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A good awareness of impact assessment types along with a good understanding of the range of environmental topics considered within SEA and EIA.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Awareness of the relevant stakeholders and organisations that need to be consulted for EIAs and SEAs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A good understanding of sustainable development, the circular economy and climate change<\u002Fli> \n  <li>An ability to adapt and prioritise appropriately whilst working on a number of varied projects at once<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Enthusiasm and curiosity to apply skills to the solution of real-world problems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A well-rounded person – have you travelled around the world? Worked in a bar? Been captain of a sports team or volunteered for a charity? Tell us - we’re looking for people with interesting stories and experiences!<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You must have the permanent right to work in Ireland.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Selection Process <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>Step 1: Apply Online<\u002Fp> \n <p>Step 2: Psychometric behavioural assessment<\u002Fp> \n <p>Step 3: Interview<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What else we provide<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>A flexible workstyle, embracing a hybrid working pattern and supporting those who need to balance work\u002Flife commitments a bit differently than others<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships<\u002Fli> \n  <li>An inclusive and diverse work environment, embracing the variety of disciplines, cultures, backgrounds and lifestyles of our employees through our Jacobs Employee Networks <\u002Fli>\n  <li>A focus on safety, health, and wellbeing, prioritising our people through a culture of caring and positive mental health champion network<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Opportunities to give back to our communities through our Collectively program, incorporating matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent.
