<b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Pharmaceutical and biotechnology products impact all our lives in some way. The projects that we execute deliver lifesaving products to patients globally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With 50 years of experience as innovators in biopharma facilities, our more than 3,800 skilled architectural, engineering and construction professionals continue to work with our clients to drive innovations in the industry. We provide a single-source of responsibility for all services, from strategy and concept through site selection and evaluation, regulatory compliance, design, constructability, construction management, commissioning, validation and startup. We also provide operations support and asset management services, including plant engineering, maintenance optimization and traditional maintenance and turnaround services.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As the largest professional services provider to the biopharmaceutical industry, clients benefit from both our local presence and global reach. We offer a full range of design and construction services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies worldwide, with a complete focus on providing maximum value for our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Key Activities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Creation and modification of specifications, drawings, datasheets and schedules to support the electrical engineering design activities described below:<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Specification, procurement, installation, testing and commissioning of MV &amp; LV Switchgear, Conventional and Intelligent Motor Control Centres, VSDs, Transformers, UPS Systems, Generators, Power Factor Correction Equipment etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>MV and LV Power system design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Electrical design required to support industrial facilities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Executing projects in a multi-discipline 3D design environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Power systems &amp; equipment, short circuit calculations &amp; analysis and co-ordination\u002Fdiscrimination studies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Design of electrical facilities to IS, EN and IEC standards including Power, Lighting, Cabling, Cable Containment Systems, Cat 6 Structured Wiring, Fire Alarm, Earthing, Lightning Protection etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiar with the Design Workflow for Inter-discipline activities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Process \u002F Piping \u002F Mechanical Packages \u002F 3D model.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Degree – Chartered an advantage<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Pharma experience a huge advantage. Will also consider Commercial experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 12 years as Electrical Engineer.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Delivery of Electrical Engineering Design to meet budget, schedule and quality requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Worked on large projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Position requires thorough knowledge of electrical design and engineering techniques.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Deep knowledge of ETCI Wiring Regulations, IEC Standards and EN Standards.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in working as part of a team in schedule driven multiple discipline projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Very good proactive communicator<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. Apply today!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) and have a meaningful, positive impact on our environments, communities, and societies worldwide. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Two of our very own Jacobs Graduates have contributed to this advert – so you’re getting a firsthand account of what it’s like to work for us!<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What we do at Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>We're invested in you and your success. Our People &amp; Places Solutions business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management. We lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients’ challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What will you get?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Graduate Development Programme is a structured 2-year scheme, aiming to progress Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. We provide the framework, mentoring and experience, to help you maximise your skills and ambition across a variety of locations and markets. On joining our scheme in September 2023, you’ll rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, where our motivations lie and, most importantly, where you can make innovative contributions to our projects and help us take a step towards a more connected and sustainable world. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>About the opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>You will join a respected and ambitious company with excellent career prospects both locally and internationally. You will work as part of a diverse and highly skilled team of over 85 stakeholder engagement and communications professionals. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The main purpose of the role is to support the delivery of comprehensive and innovative communications, public consultation and stakeholder engagement across a range of small and large scale projects, making sure communities and local people have the opportunity to be heard. The team works alongside planners, designers, technologists and engineers as well as clients to provide communications and engagement support and advice. This opportunity in to join our team in Dublin or Cork.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Qualified to degree level in the relevant subject <\u002Fli>\n  <li>A flexible and innovative self-starter who’s passionate about developing skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>An ability to adapt and prioritise appropriately whilst working on a number of varied projects at once<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Enthusiasm and curiosity to apply skills to the solution of real-world problems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A well-rounded person – have you travelled around the world? Worked in a bar? Been captain of a sports team or volunteered for a charity? <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Pharmaceutical and biotechnology products impact all our lives in some way. The projects that we execute deliver lifesaving products to patients globally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With 50 years of experience as innovators in biopharma facilities, our more than 3,800 skilled architectural, engineering and construction professionals continue to work with our clients to drive innovations in the industry. We provide a single-source of responsibility for all services, from strategy and concept through site selection and evaluation, regulatory compliance, design, constructability, construction management, commissioning, validation and startup. We also provide operations support and asset management services, including plant engineering, maintenance optimization and traditional maintenance and turnaround services.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As the largest professional services provider to the biopharmaceutical industry, clients benefit from both our local presence and global reach. We offer a full range of design and construction services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies worldwide, with a complete focus on providing maximum value for our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We're looking for a Civil Engineer for our Cork office who is excited about working on projects that enable the heart of our clients’ business. Join us and you’ll have the chance to work on projects including state of the art biotech and pharmaceutical facilities. You’ll be accountable for schedule and technical quality of challenging engineering tasks, as you gain familiarity with the client’s expectations, scope, budget, and schedule. Your multi-discipline, highly interactive team will conceptualize initial civil design for land\u002Fsite development, prepare grading plans, performing earthwork and drainage\u002Fstormwater calculations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Bring your curiosity, talent for multi-tasking and collaboration, and extreme organizational skills and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfil what drives you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>General Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As Civil Engineer, you will be an integral member of the Civil engineering design and construction support team, counted on to perform Civil analysis and design for our projects and play a key leadership role in our civil team. Depending on the size and complexity of the project, you may be part of a larger design team supporting the Senior Civil Engineer or acting as the Civil Lead yourself. You will need strong communication and interpersonal skills as you work closely with the clients, project managers, other disciplines, and construction trade partners. As part of this team, you will develop design concepts, undertake analysis and design, and work with the other Designers and Engineers as part of the wider design effort.<\u002Fp> \n <p>It is expected that you have a strong working knowledge of civil principals in many subject areas, understanding of building codes with emphasis on local jurisdictional code requirements, understand how civil design integrates with and impacts other disciplines, and understand business trends and industry issues and challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Duties and Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>With limited supervision, individual competently performs all conventional aspects of civil engineering and analysis: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Plans and conducts work requiring judgment in the independent evaluation, selection, and adaptation of engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Exercises sound engineering judgement and problem-solving skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Takes responsibility for managing workload, making and keeping commitments, and taking full ownership of assigned work: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Takes complete ownership of their portion of the civil scope, reliably meeting schedule, budget, and quality requirements.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Clearly define own scope and can forecast level of effort needed to complete that scope. Be ready to identify scope change and escalate it to Civil Lead.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Ask for help when needed, and delegate to other engineers when appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to work in a timely, accurate, and cost-effective manner with strong attention to detail.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Possesses excellent organization, communication, and interpersonal skills.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 6 years of project experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Chartered Civil Engineering qualification preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong working knowledge and experience in analyzing and designing all aspects of medium to large scale industrial developments including: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Site development, site master planning and site selection.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Underground utility routing and site space planning.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Hydrology analysis for designing storm drain systems.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Analyzing and designing gravitational wastewater systems.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Performing final grading plans including cut and fill analysis and earthwork balancing.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Support permit application process.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Working knowledge and experience with AutoCAD Civil 3D, StormCAD, Storm and Sanitary Analysis, WaterCAD and WaterGEMS preferrable.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Expertise in hydrology analysis tools including Micro Drainage software.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Strong interpersonal skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, you’ll also have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous experience in biotech, pharmaceutical or general industrial facilities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Navisworks and Bluebeam.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. This is reflected in our wide range of Global Employee Networks centred on inclusion and diversity – ACE, Careers, Enlace, Harambee, OneWorld, Prism, Vetnet, and Women’s – find out more about our employee networks here.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs partners with VERCIDA to help us attract and retain diverse talent. For greater online accessibility please visit www.vercida.com to view and access our roles. As a Disability Confident employer, we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy. We welcome applications from candidates who are seeking flexible working and from those who may not meet all the listed requirements for a role<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you require further support or reasonable adjustments with regards to the recruitment process (for example, you require the application form in a different format), please contact the team.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Your application experience is important to us and we’re keen to adapt to make every interaction even better. We welcome feedback on our recruitment process and if you need more from us before deciding to join Jacobs then please let us know.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n Apply today!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) to start your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, environment and communities. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What we do at Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our People &amp; Places Solutions (P&amp;PS) business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management. We lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients’ challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What’s in it for you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Jacobs Graduate you will join a structured 2-year programme aimed at progressing Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. Our GDP provides the framework, mentoring and expertise, supporting you to reach your full potential. On joining our programme in September 2023, you will rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, what motivates us and how you can make innovative contributions to our projects, helping us build a more connected and sustainable world.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for talented people to join us to continue our focus on building relationships and delighting our clients. In return we have opportunities to work on unique and exciting projects, and a stable platform upon which to develop your career.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The successful candidate will be provided with on-the-job training using the latest software tools and exposure to an interesting mix of projects through from concept stage to construction. You will be expected to assist and support colleagues in the preparation of feasibility studies, scheme reports, and detailed highway designs on both public and private sector projects throughout Ireland. As a new graduate within our Highways design team you will have the opportunity to make your mark and influence the continuing growth of Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul> \n  <li><p>Be working towards a Degree or Masters level qualification in Civil Engineering<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>To be a flexible and innovative self-starter who brings a curious mindset to finding solutions for real-world problems<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>The adaptability to learn, unlearn and reprioritise as things around you change<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>You must have the permanent right to work in Ireland.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>We want you to bring your whole, authentic self to Jacobs - have you travelled around the world? <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Are you ready to start your career in an inclusive, flexible, and dynamic work environment?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) to start your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, environment and communities. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Some of our very own Jacobs Graduates have contributed to this advert – so you’re getting a firsthand account of what it’s like to work with us!<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What we do at Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our People &amp; Places Solutions (P&amp;PS) business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management. We lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients’ challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What’s in it for you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Jacobs Graduate you will join a structured 2-year programme aimed at progressing Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. Our GDP provides the framework, mentoring and expertise, supporting you to reach your full potential. On joining our programme in September 2023, you will rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, what motivates us and how you can make innovative contributions to our projects, helping us build a more connected and sustainable world.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>About the opportunity<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs is seeking Civil Engineers who are looking to begin their careers in a world-class leading company with excellent career prospects. Working as part of a multi-disciplinary team, you could be providing innovative and sustainable solutions for Clients such as Water Companies, as well as less obvious Clients like Airports.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your workload will be varied across nature (rivers), infrastructure (pipelines) and non-infrastructure (facilities). You could be: -<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>designing a Sustainable Drainage System for a new development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>assessing options for managing flood risk<\u002Fli> \n  <li>diverting operationally-critical infrastructure to allow for new development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>contributing to the determination of budgets for the next five years of investment in the Water Industry<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Our Graduates are exposed to a wide range of projects and we will support you to grow and develop into the areas that you find interesting. Whatever you decide to do, our friendly teams will be on hand to help you along the way.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul> \n  <li><p>Masters degree in Civil Engineering (Class 2.1 or better) or similar equivalent<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>Demonstrable interest in working in the Water Industry and\u002For the Environment<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>Enthusiasm to solve problems and enjoy working as part of a large multi-national company<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>A desire to apply your skills to combat the real challenges faced by the world today<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>To be a flexible and innovative self-starter who brings a curious mindset to finding solutions for real-world problems<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>The adaptability to learn, unlearn and reprioritise as things around you change<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n  <li><p>You must have the permanent right to work in Ireland.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>We want you to bring your whole, authentic self to Jacobs - have you travelled around the world? <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we'll inspire and empower you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. With more than 55,000 people in 40+ countries, working at Jacobs offers an exciting range of opportunities to develop your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, clients and communities.<\u002Fp> \n <p>People are Jacobs’ greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package to retain and attract the best talent. Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Jacobs. We’re happy to discuss hybrid, part-time and flexible working hours, patterns and locations to suit you and our business.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Pharmaceutical and biotechnology products impact all our lives in some way. The projects that we execute deliver lifesaving products to patients globally.<\u002Fp> \n <p>With 50 years of experience as innovators in biopharma facilities, our more than 3,800 skilled architectural, engineering and construction professionals continue to work with our clients to drive innovations in the industry. We provide a single-source of responsibility for all services, from strategy and concept through site selection and evaluation, regulatory compliance, design, constructability, construction management, commissioning, validation and startup. We also provide operations support and asset management services, including plant engineering, maintenance optimization and traditional maintenance and turnaround services.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As the largest professional services provider to the biopharmaceutical industry, clients benefit from both our local presence and global reach. We offer a full range of design and construction services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies worldwide, with a complete focus on providing maximum value for our clients.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Key Activities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Creation and modification of specifications, drawings, datasheets and schedules to support the electrical engineering design activities described below:<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Specification, procurement, installation, testing and commissioning of MV &amp; LV Switchgear, Conventional and Intelligent Motor Control Centres, VSDs, Transformers, UPS Systems, Generators, Power Factor Correction Equipment etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>MV and LV Power system design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Electrical design required to support industrial facilities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Executing projects in a multi-discipline 3D design environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Power systems &amp; equipment, short circuit calculations &amp; analysis and co-ordination\u002Fdiscrimination studies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Design of electrical facilities to IS, EN and IEC standards including Power, Lighting, Cabling, Cable Containment Systems, Cat 6 Structured Wiring, Fire Alarm, Earthing, Lightning Protection etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiar with the Design Workflow for Inter-discipline activities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Process \u002F Piping \u002F Mechanical Packages \u002F 3D model.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>#globallifescience<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Degree – Chartered an advantage<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Pharma experience a huge advantage. Will also consider Commercial experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 12 years as Electrical Engineer.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Delivery of Electrical Engineering Design to meet budget, schedule and quality requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Worked on large projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Position requires thorough knowledge of electrical design and engineering techniques.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Deep knowledge of ETCI Wiring Regulations, IEC Standards and EN Standards.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in working as part of a team in schedule driven multiple discipline projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Very good proactive communicator<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our values stand on a foundation of safety, integrity, inclusion and diversity. We put people at the heart of our business and we truly believe that by supporting one another through our culture of caring, we all succeed. We value positive mental health and a sense of belonging for all employees. Find out more about life at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We aim to embed inclusion and diversity in everything we do. We know that if we are inclusive, we’re more connected, and if we are diverse, we’re more creative. We accept people for who they are, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Are you ready to start your career in an inclusive, flexible, and dynamic work environment?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) to start your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, environment and communities. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Some of our very own Jacobs Graduates have contributed to this advert – so you’re getting a firsthand account of what it’s like to work with us!<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What we do at Jacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our People &amp; Places Solutions (P&amp;PS) business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management. We lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients’ challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>What’s in it for you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Jacobs Graduate you will join a structured 2-year programme aimed at progressing Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. Our GDP provides the framework, mentoring and expertise, supporting you to reach your full potential. On joining our programme in September 2023, you will rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, what motivates us and how you can make innovative contributions to our projects, helping us build a more connected and sustainable world.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul> \n  <li><p>Be working towards a relevant Masters or Bachelors degree in Engineering Geology, Geoscience, or Geotechnical Engineering or Civil Engineering (MEng).
